      <title>Twelfth Night, or What You Will</title>

            <h1>Twelfth Night, or What You Will</h1>

         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">ORSINO, Duke of Illyria. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SEBASTIAN, brother to Viola.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">ANTONIO, a sea captain, friend to Sebastian.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Sea Captain, friend to Viola. </span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">VALENTINE</span>
                        <span class="personname">CURIO</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">gentlemen attending on the Duke.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR TOBY BELCH, uncle to Olivia.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR ANDREW AGUECHEEK</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">MALVOLIO, steward to Olivia.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">FABIAN</span>
                        <span class="personname">FESTE, a Clown  </span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">servants to Olivia.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">OLIVIA</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">VIOLA</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">MARIA, Olivia's woman.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Lords, Priests, Sailors, Officers, Musicians, and other Attendants.</span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  A city in Illyria, and the sea-coast near it.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  DUKE ORSINO's palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  The sea-coast.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  OLIVIA'S house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.5">4. SCENE IV.  DUKE ORSINO's palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.6">5. SCENE V.  OLIVIA'S house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  DUKE ORSINO's palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DUKE ORSINO, CURIO, and other Lords;
Musicians attending</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">If music be the food of love, play on;</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me excess of it, that, surfeiting,</div>
                     <div class="line">The appetite may sicken, and so die.</div>
                     <div class="line">That strain again! it had a dying fall:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, it came o'er my ear like the sweet sound,</div>
                     <div class="line">That breathes upon a bank of violets,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stealing and giving odour! Enough; no more:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not so sweet now as it was before.</div>
                     <div class="line">O spirit of love! how quick and fresh art thou,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, notwithstanding thy capacity</div>
                     <div class="line">Receiveth as the sea, nought enters there,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of what validity and pitch soe'er,</div>
                     <div class="line">But falls into abatement and low price,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in a minute: so full of shapes is fancy</div>
                     <div class="line">That it alone is high fantastical.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CURIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you go hunt, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">What, Curio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CURIO</div>
                     <div class="line">The hart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, so I do, the noblest that I have:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, when mine eyes did see Olivia first,</div>
                     <div class="line">Methought she purged the air of pestilence!</div>
                     <div class="line">That instant was I turn'd into a hart;</div>
                     <div class="line">And my desires, like fell and cruel hounds,</div>
                     <div class="line">E'er since pursue me.</div>
                     <p>Enter VALENTINE</p>
                     <div class="line">How now! what news from her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">So please my lord, I might not be admitted;</div>
                     <div class="line">But from her handmaid do return this answer:</div>
                     <div class="line">The element itself, till seven years' heat,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall not behold her face at ample view;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, like a cloistress, she will veiled walk</div>
                     <div class="line">And water once a day her chamber round</div>
                     <div class="line">With eye-offending brine: all this to season</div>
                     <div class="line">A brother's dead love, which she would keep fresh</div>
                     <div class="line">And lasting in her sad remembrance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, she that hath a heart of that fine frame</div>
                     <div class="line">To pay this debt of love but to a brother,</div>
                     <div class="line">How will she love, when the rich golden shaft</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath kill'd the flock of all affections else</div>
                     <div class="line">That live in her; when liver, brain and heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">These sovereign thrones, are all supplied, and fill'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Her sweet perfections with one self king!</div>
                     <div class="line">Away before me to sweet beds of flowers:</div>
                     <div class="line">Love-thoughts lie rich when canopied with bowers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The sea-coast.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter VIOLA, a Captain, and Sailors</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">What country, friends, is this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">This is Illyria, lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">And what should I do in Illyria?</div>
                     <div class="line">My brother he is in Elysium.</div>
                     <div class="line">Perchance he is not drown'd: what think you, sailors?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">It is perchance that you yourself were saved.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">O my poor brother! and so perchance may he be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">True, madam: and, to comfort you with chance,</div>
                     <div class="line">Assure yourself, after our ship did split,</div>
                     <div class="line">When you and those poor number saved with you</div>
                     <div class="line">Hung on our driving boat, I saw your brother,</div>
                     <div class="line">Most provident in peril, bind himself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Courage and hope both teaching him the practise,</div>
                     <div class="line">To a strong mast that lived upon the sea;</div>
                     <div class="line">Where, like Arion on the dolphin's back,</div>
                     <div class="line">I saw him hold acquaintance with the waves</div>
                     <div class="line">So long as I could see.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">For saying so, there's gold:</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine own escape unfoldeth to my hope,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereto thy speech serves for authority,</div>
                     <div class="line">The like of him. Know'st thou this country?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, madam, well; for I was bred and born</div>
                     <div class="line">Not three hours' travel from this very place.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Who governs here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">A noble duke, in nature as in name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">What is the name?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Orsino.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Orsino! I have heard my father name him:</div>
                     <div class="line">He was a bachelor then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">And so is now, or was so very late;</div>
                     <div class="line">For but a month ago I went from hence,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then 'twas fresh in murmur,--as, you know,</div>
                     <div class="line">What great ones do the less will prattle of,--</div>
                     <div class="line">That he did seek the love of fair Olivia.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">What's she?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">A virtuous maid, the daughter of a count</div>
                     <div class="line">That died some twelvemonth since, then leaving her</div>
                     <div class="line">In the protection of his son, her brother,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who shortly also died: for whose dear love,</div>
                     <div class="line">They say, she hath abjured the company</div>
                     <div class="line">And sight of men.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">O that I served that lady</div>
                     <div class="line">And might not be delivered to the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till I had made mine own occasion mellow,</div>
                     <div class="line">What my estate is!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">That were hard to compass;</div>
                     <div class="line">Because she will admit no kind of suit,</div>
                     <div class="line">No, not the duke's.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">There is a fair behavior in thee, captain;</div>
                     <div class="line">And though that nature with a beauteous wall</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth oft close in pollution, yet of thee</div>
                     <div class="line">I will believe thou hast a mind that suits</div>
                     <div class="line">With this thy fair and outward character.</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, and I'll pay thee bounteously,</div>
                     <div class="line">Conceal me what I am, and be my aid</div>
                     <div class="line">For such disguise as haply shall become</div>
                     <div class="line">The form of my intent. I'll serve this duke:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shall present me as an eunuch to him:</div>
                     <div class="line">It may be worth thy pains; for I can sing</div>
                     <div class="line">And speak to him in many sorts of music</div>
                     <div class="line">That will allow me very worth his service.</div>
                     <div class="line">What else may hap to time I will commit;</div>
                     <div class="line">Only shape thou thy silence to my wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Be you his eunuch, and your mute I'll be:</div>
                     <div class="line">When my tongue blabs, then let mine eyes not see.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank thee: lead me on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  OLIVIA'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SIR TOBY BELCH and MARIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">What a plague means my niece, to take the death of</div>
                     <div class="line">her brother thus? I am sure care's an enemy to life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, Sir Toby, you must come in earlier o'</div>
                     <div class="line">nights: your cousin, my lady, takes great</div>
                     <div class="line">exceptions to your ill hours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, let her except, before excepted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but you must confine yourself within the modest</div>
                     <div class="line">limits of order.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Confine! I'll confine myself no finer than I am:</div>
                     <div class="line">these clothes are good enough to drink in; and so be</div>
                     <div class="line">these boots too: an they be not, let them hang</div>
                     <div class="line">themselves in their own straps.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">That quaffing and drinking will undo you: I heard</div>
                     <div class="line">my lady talk of it yesterday; and of a foolish</div>
                     <div class="line">knight that you brought in one night here to be her wooer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, Sir Andrew Aguecheek?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, he.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">He's as tall a man as any's in Illyria.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What's that to the purpose?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, he has three thousand ducats a year.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but he'll have but a year in all these ducats:</div>
                     <div class="line">he's a very fool and a prodigal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, that you'll say so! he plays o' the</div>
                     <div class="line">viol-de-gamboys, and speaks three or four languages</div>
                     <div class="line">word for word without book, and hath all the good</div>
                     <div class="line">gifts of nature.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath indeed, almost natural: for besides that</div>
                     <div class="line">he's a fool, he's a great quarreller: and but that</div>
                     <div class="line">he hath the gift of a coward to allay the gust he</div>
                     <div class="line">hath in quarrelling, 'tis thought among the prudent</div>
                     <div class="line">he would quickly have the gift of a grave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">By this hand, they are scoundrels and subtractors</div>
                     <div class="line">that say so of him. Who are they?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">They that add, moreover, he's drunk nightly in your company.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">With drinking healths to my niece: I'll drink to</div>
                     <div class="line">her as long as there is a passage in my throat and</div>
                     <div class="line">drink in Illyria: he's a coward and a coystrill</div>
                     <div class="line">that will not drink to my niece till his brains turn</div>
                     <div class="line">o' the toe like a parish-top. What, wench!</div>
                     <div class="line">Castiliano vulgo! for here comes Sir Andrew Agueface.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SIR ANDREW</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Toby Belch! how now, Sir Toby Belch!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet Sir Andrew!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Bless you, fair shrew.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">And you too, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Accost, Sir Andrew, accost.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">What's that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">My niece's chambermaid.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Mistress Accost, I desire better acquaintance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">My name is Mary, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Mistress Mary Accost,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">You mistake, knight; 'accost' is front her, board</div>
                     <div class="line">her, woo her, assail her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, I would not undertake her in this</div>
                     <div class="line">company. Is that the meaning of 'accost'?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Fare you well, gentlemen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">An thou let part so, Sir Andrew, would thou mightst</div>
                     <div class="line">never draw sword again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">An you part so, mistress, I would I might never</div>
                     <div class="line">draw sword again. Fair lady, do you think you have</div>
                     <div class="line">fools in hand?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I have not you by the hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, but you shall have; and here's my hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, sir, 'thought is free:' I pray you, bring</div>
                     <div class="line">your hand to the buttery-bar and let it drink.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherefore, sweet-heart? what's your metaphor?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">It's dry, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, I think so: I am not such an ass but I can</div>
                     <div class="line">keep my hand dry. But what's your jest?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">A dry jest, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you full of them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir, I have them at my fingers' ends: marry,</div>
                     <div class="line">now I let go your hand, I am barren.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">O knight thou lackest a cup of canary: when did I</div>
                     <div class="line">see thee so put down?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Never in your life, I think; unless you see canary</div>
                     <div class="line">put me down. Methinks sometimes I have no more wit</div>
                     <div class="line">than a Christian or an ordinary man has: but I am a</div>
                     <div class="line">great eater of beef and I believe that does harm to my wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">No question.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">An I thought that, I'ld forswear it. I'll ride home</div>
                     <div class="line">to-morrow, Sir Toby.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Pourquoi, my dear knight?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">What is 'Pourquoi'? do or not do? I would I had</div>
                     <div class="line">bestowed that time in the tongues that I have in</div>
                     <div class="line">fencing, dancing and bear-baiting: O, had I but</div>
                     <div class="line">followed the arts!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Then hadst thou had an excellent head of hair.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, would that have mended my hair?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Past question; for thou seest it will not curl by nature.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">But it becomes me well enough, does't not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Excellent; it hangs like flax on a distaff; and I</div>
                     <div class="line">hope to see a housewife take thee between her legs</div>
                     <div class="line">and spin it off.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, I'll home to-morrow, Sir Toby: your niece</div>
                     <div class="line">will not be seen; or if she be, it's four to one</div>
                     <div class="line">she'll none of me: the count himself here hard by woos her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">She'll none o' the count: she'll not match above</div>
                     <div class="line">her degree, neither in estate, years, nor wit; I</div>
                     <div class="line">have heard her swear't. Tut, there's life in't,</div>
                     <div class="line">man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll stay a month longer. I am a fellow o' the</div>
                     <div class="line">strangest mind i' the world; I delight in masques</div>
                     <div class="line">and revels sometimes altogether.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou good at these kickshawses, knight?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">As any man in Illyria, whatsoever he be, under the</div>
                     <div class="line">degree of my betters; and yet I will not compare</div>
                     <div class="line">with an old man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">What is thy excellence in a galliard, knight?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, I can cut a caper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">And I can cut the mutton to't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">And I think I have the back-trick simply as strong</div>
                     <div class="line">as any man in Illyria.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherefore are these things hid? wherefore have</div>
                     <div class="line">these gifts a curtain before 'em? are they like to</div>
                     <div class="line">take dust, like Mistress Mall's picture? why dost</div>
                     <div class="line">thou not go to church in a galliard and come home in</div>
                     <div class="line">a coranto? My very walk should be a jig; I would not</div>
                     <div class="line">so much as make water but in a sink-a-pace. What</div>
                     <div class="line">dost thou mean? Is it a world to hide virtues in?</div>
                     <div class="line">I did think, by the excellent constitution of thy</div>
                     <div class="line">leg, it was formed under the star of a galliard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, 'tis strong, and it does indifferent well in a</div>
                     <div class="line">flame-coloured stock. Shall we set about some revels?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">What shall we do else? were we not born under Taurus?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Taurus! That's sides and heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">No, sir; it is legs and thighs. Let me see the</div>
                     <div class="line">caper; ha! higher: ha, ha! excellent!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  DUKE ORSINO's palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter VALENTINE and VIOLA in man's attire</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">If the duke continue these favours towards you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cesario, you are like to be much advanced: he hath</div>
                     <div class="line">known you but three days, and already you are no stranger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">You either fear his humour or my negligence, that</div>
                     <div class="line">you call in question the continuance of his love:</div>
                     <div class="line">is he inconstant, sir, in his favours?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, believe me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank you. Here comes the count.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DUKE ORSINO, CURIO, and Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Who saw Cesario, ho?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">On your attendance, my lord; here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand you a while aloof, Cesario,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou know'st no less but all; I have unclasp'd</div>
                     <div class="line">To thee the book even of my secret soul:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, good youth, address thy gait unto her;</div>
                     <div class="line">Be not denied access, stand at her doors,</div>
                     <div class="line">And tell them, there thy fixed foot shall grow</div>
                     <div class="line">Till thou have audience.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Sure, my noble lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">If she be so abandon'd to her sorrow</div>
                     <div class="line">As it is spoke, she never will admit me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Be clamorous and leap all civil bounds</div>
                     <div class="line">Rather than make unprofited return.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Say I do speak with her, my lord, what then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, then unfold the passion of my love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Surprise her with discourse of my dear faith:</div>
                     <div class="line">It shall become thee well to act my woes;</div>
                     <div class="line">She will attend it better in thy youth</div>
                     <div class="line">Than in a nuncio's of more grave aspect.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I think not so, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Dear lad, believe it;</div>
                     <div class="line">For they shall yet belie thy happy years,</div>
                     <div class="line">That say thou art a man: Diana's lip</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not more smooth and rubious; thy small pipe</div>
                     <div class="line">Is as the maiden's organ, shrill and sound,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all is semblative a woman's part.</div>
                     <div class="line">I know thy constellation is right apt</div>
                     <div class="line">For this affair. Some four or five attend him;</div>
                     <div class="line">All, if you will; for I myself am best</div>
                     <div class="line">When least in company. Prosper well in this,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou shalt live as freely as thy lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">To call his fortunes thine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll do my best</div>
                     <div class="line">To woo your lady:</div>
                     <p>Aside</p>
                     <div class="line">yet, a barful strife!</div>
                     <div class="line">Whoe'er I woo, myself would be his wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  OLIVIA'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter MARIA and Clown</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, either tell me where thou hast been, or I will</div>
                     <div class="line">not open my lips so wide as a bristle may enter in</div>
                     <div class="line">way of thy excuse: my lady will hang thee for thy absence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Let her hang me: he that is well hanged in this</div>
                     <div class="line">world needs to fear no colours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Make that good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall see none to fear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">A good lenten answer: I can tell thee where that</div>
                     <div class="line">saying was born, of 'I fear no colours.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Where, good Mistress Mary?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">In the wars; and that may you be bold to say in your foolery.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, God give them wisdom that have it; and those</div>
                     <div class="line">that are fools, let them use their talents.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet you will be hanged for being so long absent; or,</div>
                     <div class="line">to be turned away, is not that as good as a hanging to you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Many a good hanging prevents a bad marriage; and,</div>
                     <div class="line">for turning away, let summer bear it out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">You are resolute, then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Not so, neither; but I am resolved on two points.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">That if one break, the other will hold; or, if both</div>
                     <div class="line">break, your gaskins fall.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Apt, in good faith; very apt. Well, go thy way; if</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Toby would leave drinking, thou wert as witty a</div>
                     <div class="line">piece of Eve's flesh as any in Illyria.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, you rogue, no more o' that. Here comes my</div>
                     <div class="line">lady: make your excuse wisely, you were best.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Wit, an't be thy will, put me into good fooling!</div>
                     <div class="line">Those wits, that think they have thee, do very oft</div>
                     <div class="line">prove fools; and I, that am sure I lack thee, may</div>
                     <div class="line">pass for a wise man: for what says Quinapalus?</div>
                     <div class="line">'Better a witty fool, than a foolish wit.'</div>
                     <p>Enter OLIVIA with MALVOLIO</p>
                     <div class="line">God bless thee, lady!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Take the fool away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you not hear, fellows? Take away the lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to, you're a dry fool; I'll no more of you:</div>
                     <div class="line">besides, you grow dishonest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Two faults, madonna, that drink and good counsel</div>
                     <div class="line">will amend: for give the dry fool drink, then is</div>
                     <div class="line">the fool not dry: bid the dishonest man mend</div>
                     <div class="line">himself; if he mend, he is no longer dishonest; if</div>
                     <div class="line">he cannot, let the botcher mend him. Any thing</div>
                     <div class="line">that's mended is but patched: virtue that</div>
                     <div class="line">transgresses is but patched with sin; and sin that</div>
                     <div class="line">amends is but patched with virtue. If that this</div>
                     <div class="line">simple syllogism will serve, so; if it will not,</div>
                     <div class="line">what remedy? As there is no true cuckold but</div>
                     <div class="line">calamity, so beauty's a flower. The lady bade take</div>
                     <div class="line">away the fool; therefore, I say again, take her away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I bade them take away you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Misprision in the highest degree! Lady, cucullus non</div>
                     <div class="line">facit monachum; that's as much to say as I wear not</div>
                     <div class="line">motley in my brain. Good madonna, give me leave to</div>
                     <div class="line">prove you a fool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Can you do it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Dexterously, good madonna.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Make your proof.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">I must catechise you for it, madonna: good my mouse</div>
                     <div class="line">of virtue, answer me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, sir, for want of other idleness, I'll bide your proof.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Good madonna, why mournest thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Good fool, for my brother's death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">I think his soul is in hell, madonna.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I know his soul is in heaven, fool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">The more fool, madonna, to mourn for your brother's</div>
                     <div class="line">soul being in heaven. Take away the fool, gentlemen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What think you of this fool, Malvolio? doth he not mend?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, and shall do till the pangs of death shake him:</div>
                     <div class="line">infirmity, that decays the wise, doth ever make the</div>
                     <div class="line">better fool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">God send you, sir, a speedy infirmity, for the</div>
                     <div class="line">better increasing your folly! Sir Toby will be</div>
                     <div class="line">sworn that I am no fox; but he will not pass his</div>
                     <div class="line">word for two pence that you are no fool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">How say you to that, Malvolio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I marvel your ladyship takes delight in such a</div>
                     <div class="line">barren rascal: I saw him put down the other day</div>
                     <div class="line">with an ordinary fool that has no more brain</div>
                     <div class="line">than a stone. Look you now, he's out of his guard</div>
                     <div class="line">already; unless you laugh and minister occasion to</div>
                     <div class="line">him, he is gagged. I protest, I take these wise men,</div>
                     <div class="line">that crow so at these set kind of fools, no better</div>
                     <div class="line">than the fools' zanies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Oh, you are sick of self-love, Malvolio, and taste</div>
                     <div class="line">with a distempered appetite. To be generous,</div>
                     <div class="line">guiltless and of free disposition, is to take those</div>
                     <div class="line">things for bird-bolts that you deem cannon-bullets:</div>
                     <div class="line">there is no slander in an allowed fool, though he do</div>
                     <div class="line">nothing but rail; nor no railing in a known discreet</div>
                     <div class="line">man, though he do nothing but reprove.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Now Mercury endue thee with leasing, for thou</div>
                     <div class="line">speakest well of fools!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter MARIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, there is at the gate a young gentleman much</div>
                     <div class="line">desires to speak with you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">From the Count Orsino, is it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not, madam: 'tis a fair young man, and well attended.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Who of my people hold him in delay?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Toby, madam, your kinsman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Fetch him off, I pray you; he speaks nothing but</div>
                     <div class="line">madman: fie on him!</div>
                     <p>Exit MARIA</p>
                     <div class="line">Go you, Malvolio: if it be a suit from the count, I</div>
                     <div class="line">am sick, or not at home; what you will, to dismiss it.</div>
                     <p>Exit MALVOLIO</p>
                     <div class="line">Now you see, sir, how your fooling grows old, and</div>
                     <div class="line">people dislike it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast spoke for us, madonna, as if thy eldest</div>
                     <div class="line">son should be a fool; whose skull Jove cram with</div>
                     <div class="line">brains! for,--here he comes,--one of thy kin has a</div>
                     <div class="line">most weak pia mater.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SIR TOBY BELCH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">By mine honour, half drunk. What is he at the gate, cousin?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">A gentleman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">A gentleman! what gentleman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis a gentle man here--a plague o' these</div>
                     <div class="line">pickle-herring! How now, sot!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Sir Toby!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Cousin, cousin, how have you come so early by this lethargy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Lechery! I defy lechery. There's one at the gate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, marry, what is he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him be the devil, an he will, I care not: give</div>
                     <div class="line">me faith, say I. Well, it's all one.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What's a drunken man like, fool?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Like a drowned man, a fool and a mad man: one</div>
                     <div class="line">draught above heat makes him a fool; the second mads</div>
                     <div class="line">him; and a third drowns him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Go thou and seek the crowner, and let him sit o' my</div>
                     <div class="line">coz; for he's in the third degree of drink, he's</div>
                     <div class="line">drowned: go, look after him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">He is but mad yet, madonna; and the fool shall look</div>
                     <div class="line">to the madman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Re-enter MALVOLIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, yond young fellow swears he will speak with</div>
                     <div class="line">you. I told him you were sick; he takes on him to</div>
                     <div class="line">understand so much, and therefore comes to speak</div>
                     <div class="line">with you. I told him you were asleep; he seems to</div>
                     <div class="line">have a foreknowledge of that too, and therefore</div>
                     <div class="line">comes to speak with you. What is to be said to him,</div>
                     <div class="line">lady? he's fortified against any denial.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell him he shall not speak with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Has been told so; and he says, he'll stand at your</div>
                     <div class="line">door like a sheriff's post, and be the supporter to</div>
                     <div class="line">a bench, but he'll speak with you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What kind o' man is he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, of mankind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What manner of man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Of very ill manner; he'll speak with you, will you or no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Of what personage and years is he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Not yet old enough for a man, nor young enough for</div>
                     <div class="line">a boy; as a squash is before 'tis a peascod, or a</div>
                     <div class="line">cooling when 'tis almost an apple: 'tis with him</div>
                     <div class="line">in standing water, between boy and man. He is very</div>
                     <div class="line">well-favoured and he speaks very shrewishly; one</div>
                     <div class="line">would think his mother's milk were scarce out of him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him approach: call in my gentlewoman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentlewoman, my lady calls.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Re-enter MARIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me my veil: come, throw it o'er my face.</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll once more hear Orsino's embassy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter VIOLA, and Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">The honourable lady of the house, which is she?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak to me; I shall answer for her.</div>
                     <div class="line">Your will?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Most radiant, exquisite and unmatchable beauty,--I</div>
                     <div class="line">pray you, tell me if this be the lady of the house,</div>
                     <div class="line">for I never saw her: I would be loath to cast away</div>
                     <div class="line">my speech, for besides that it is excellently well</div>
                     <div class="line">penned, I have taken great pains to con it. Good</div>
                     <div class="line">beauties, let me sustain no scorn; I am very</div>
                     <div class="line">comptible, even to the least sinister usage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Whence came you, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I can say little more than I have studied, and that</div>
                     <div class="line">question's out of my part. Good gentle one, give me</div>
                     <div class="line">modest assurance if you be the lady of the house,</div>
                     <div class="line">that I may proceed in my speech.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you a comedian?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my profound heart: and yet, by the very fangs</div>
                     <div class="line">of malice I swear, I am not that I play. Are you</div>
                     <div class="line">the lady of the house?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">If I do not usurp myself, I am.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Most certain, if you are she, you do usurp</div>
                     <div class="line">yourself; for what is yours to bestow is not yours</div>
                     <div class="line">to reserve. But this is from my commission: I will</div>
                     <div class="line">on with my speech in your praise, and then show you</div>
                     <div class="line">the heart of my message.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
