                     <div class="line">To her in haste; give her this jewel; say,</div>
                     <div class="line">My love can give no place, bide no denay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  OLIVIA's garden.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SIR TOBY BELCH, SIR ANDREW, and FABIAN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Come thy ways, Signior Fabian.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I'll come: if I lose a scruple of this sport,</div>
                     <div class="line">let me be boiled to death with melancholy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Wouldst thou not be glad to have the niggardly</div>
                     <div class="line">rascally sheep-biter come by some notable shame?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I would exult, man: you know, he brought me out o'</div>
                     <div class="line">favour with my lady about a bear-baiting here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">To anger him we'll have the bear again; and we will</div>
                     <div class="line">fool him black and blue: shall we not, Sir Andrew?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">An we do not, it is pity of our lives.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes the little villain.</div>
                     <p>Enter MARIA</p>
                     <div class="line">How now, my metal of India!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Get ye all three into the box-tree: Malvolio's</div>
                     <div class="line">coming down this walk: he has been yonder i' the</div>
                     <div class="line">sun practising behavior to his own shadow this half</div>
                     <div class="line">hour: observe him, for the love of mockery; for I</div>
                     <div class="line">know this letter will make a contemplative idiot of</div>
                     <div class="line">him. Close, in the name of jesting! Lie thou there,</div>
                     <p>Throws down a letter</p>
                     <div class="line">for here comes the trout that must be caught with tickling.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Enter MALVOLIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis but fortune; all is fortune. Maria once told</div>
                     <div class="line">me she did affect me: and I have heard herself come</div>
                     <div class="line">thus near, that, should she fancy, it should be one</div>
                     <div class="line">of my complexion. Besides, she uses me with a more</div>
                     <div class="line">exalted respect than any one else that follows her.</div>
                     <div class="line">What should I think on't?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's an overweening rogue!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">O, peace! Contemplation makes a rare turkey-cock</div>
                     <div class="line">of him: how he jets under his advanced plumes!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">'Slight, I could so beat the rogue!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, I say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">To be Count Malvolio!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, rogue!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Pistol him, pistol him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, peace!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">There is example for't; the lady of the Strachy</div>
                     <div class="line">married the yeoman of the wardrobe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie on him, Jezebel!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">O, peace! now he's deeply in: look how</div>
                     <div class="line">imagination blows him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Having been three months married to her, sitting in</div>
                     <div class="line">my state,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">O, for a stone-bow, to hit him in the eye!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Calling my officers about me, in my branched velvet</div>
                     <div class="line">gown; having come from a day-bed, where I have left</div>
                     <div class="line">Olivia sleeping,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Fire and brimstone!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">O, peace, peace!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And then to have the humour of state; and after a</div>
                     <div class="line">demure travel of regard, telling them I know my</div>
                     <div class="line">place as I would they should do theirs, to for my</div>
                     <div class="line">kinsman Toby,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Bolts and shackles!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">O peace, peace, peace! now, now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Seven of my people, with an obedient start, make</div>
                     <div class="line">out for him: I frown the while; and perchance wind</div>
                     <div class="line">up watch, or play with my--some rich jewel. Toby</div>
                     <div class="line">approaches; courtesies there to me,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall this fellow live?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Though our silence be drawn from us with cars, yet peace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I extend my hand to him thus, quenching my familiar</div>
                     <div class="line">smile with an austere regard of control,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">And does not Toby take you a blow o' the lips then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Saying, 'Cousin Toby, my fortunes having cast me on</div>
                     <div class="line">your niece give me this prerogative of speech,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">What, what?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'You must amend your drunkenness.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, scab!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, patience, or we break the sinews of our plot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Besides, you waste the treasure of your time with</div>
                     <div class="line">a foolish knight,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">That's me, I warrant you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'One Sir Andrew,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">I knew 'twas I; for many do call me fool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">What employment have we here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Taking up the letter</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Now is the woodcock near the gin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">O, peace! and the spirit of humour intimate reading</div>
                     <div class="line">aloud to him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">By my life, this is my lady's hand these be her</div>
                     <div class="line">very C's, her U's and her T's and thus makes she her</div>
                     <div class="line">great P's. It is, in contempt of question, her hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Her C's, her U's and her T's: why that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'To the unknown beloved, this, and my good</div>
                     <div class="line">wishes:'--her very phrases! By your leave, wax.</div>
                     <div class="line">Soft! and the impressure her Lucrece, with which she</div>
                     <div class="line">uses to seal: 'tis my lady. To whom should this be?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">This wins him, liver and all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">Jove knows I love: But who?</div>
                     <div class="line">Lips, do not move;</div>
                     <div class="line">No man must know.</div>
                     <div class="line">'No man must know.' What follows? the numbers</div>
                     <div class="line">altered! 'No man must know:' if this should be</div>
                     <div class="line">thee, Malvolio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, hang thee, brock!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">I may command where I adore;</div>
                     <div class="line">But silence, like a Lucrece knife,</div>
                     <div class="line">With bloodless stroke my heart doth gore:</div>
                     <div class="line">M, O, A, I, doth sway my life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">A fustian riddle!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Excellent wench, say I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'M, O, A, I, doth sway my life.' Nay, but first, let</div>
                     <div class="line">me see, let me see, let me see.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">What dish o' poison has she dressed him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">And with what wing the staniel cheques at it!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'I may command where I adore.' Why, she may command</div>
                     <div class="line">me: I serve her; she is my lady. Why, this is</div>
                     <div class="line">evident to any formal capacity; there is no</div>
                     <div class="line">obstruction in this: and the end,--what should</div>
                     <div class="line">that alphabetical position portend? If I could make</div>
                     <div class="line">that resemble something in me,--Softly! M, O, A,</div>
                     <div class="line">I,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">O, ay, make up that: he is now at a cold scent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Sowter will cry upon't for all this, though it be as</div>
                     <div class="line">rank as a fox.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">M,--Malvolio; M,--why, that begins my name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Did not I say he would work it out? the cur is</div>
                     <div class="line">excellent at faults.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">M,--but then there is no consonancy in the sequel;</div>
                     <div class="line">that suffers under probation A should follow but O does.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">And O shall end, I hope.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, or I'll cudgel him, and make him cry O!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And then I comes behind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, an you had any eye behind you, you might see</div>
                     <div class="line">more detraction at your heels than fortunes before</div>
                     <div class="line">you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">M, O, A, I; this simulation is not as the former: and</div>
                     <div class="line">yet, to crush this a little, it would bow to me, for</div>
                     <div class="line">every one of these letters are in my name. Soft!</div>
                     <div class="line">here follows prose.</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'If this fall into thy hand, revolve. In my stars I</div>
                     <div class="line">am above thee; but be not afraid of greatness: some</div>
                     <div class="line">are born great, some achieve greatness, and some</div>
                     <div class="line">have greatness thrust upon 'em. Thy Fates open</div>
                     <div class="line">their hands; let thy blood and spirit embrace them;</div>
                     <div class="line">and, to inure thyself to what thou art like to be,</div>
                     <div class="line">cast thy humble slough and appear fresh. Be</div>
                     <div class="line">opposite with a kinsman, surly with servants; let</div>
                     <div class="line">thy tongue tang arguments of state; put thyself into</div>
                     <div class="line">the trick of singularity: she thus advises thee</div>
                     <div class="line">that sighs for thee. Remember who commended thy</div>
                     <div class="line">yellow stockings, and wished to see thee ever</div>
                     <div class="line">cross-gartered: I say, remember. Go to, thou art</div>
                     <div class="line">made, if thou desirest to be so; if not, let me see</div>
                     <div class="line">thee a steward still, the fellow of servants, and</div>
                     <div class="line">not worthy to touch Fortune's fingers. Farewell.</div>
                     <div class="line">She that would alter services with thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">THE FORTUNATE-UNHAPPY.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Daylight and champaign discovers not more: this is</div>
                     <div class="line">open. I will be proud, I will read politic authors,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will baffle Sir Toby, I will wash off gross</div>
                     <div class="line">acquaintance, I will be point-devise the very man.</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not now fool myself, to let imagination jade</div>
                     <div class="line">me; for every reason excites to this, that my lady</div>
                     <div class="line">loves me. She did commend my yellow stockings of</div>
                     <div class="line">late, she did praise my leg being cross-gartered;</div>
                     <div class="line">and in this she manifests herself to my love, and</div>
                     <div class="line">with a kind of injunction drives me to these habits</div>
                     <div class="line">of her liking. I thank my stars I am happy. I will</div>
                     <div class="line">be strange, stout, in yellow stockings, and</div>
                     <div class="line">cross-gartered, even with the swiftness of putting</div>
                     <div class="line">on. Jove and my stars be praised! Here is yet a</div>
                     <div class="line">postscript.</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'Thou canst not choose but know who I am. If thou</div>
                     <div class="line">entertainest my love, let it appear in thy smiling;</div>
                     <div class="line">thy smiles become thee well; therefore in my</div>
                     <div class="line">presence still smile, dear my sweet, I prithee.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Jove, I thank thee: I will smile; I will do</div>
                     <div class="line">everything that thou wilt have me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not give my part of this sport for a pension</div>
                     <div class="line">of thousands to be paid from the Sophy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">I could marry this wench for this device.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">So could I too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">And ask no other dowry with her but such another jest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor I neither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes my noble gull-catcher.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter MARIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou set thy foot o' my neck?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Or o' mine either?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I play my freedom at traytrip, and become thy</div>
                     <div class="line">bond-slave?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">I' faith, or I either?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, thou hast put him in such a dream, that when</div>
                     <div class="line">the image of it leaves him he must run mad.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, but say true; does it work upon him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Like aqua-vitae with a midwife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">If you will then see the fruits of the sport, mark</div>
                     <div class="line">his first approach before my lady: he will come to</div>
                     <div class="line">her in yellow stockings, and 'tis a colour she</div>
                     <div class="line">abhors, and cross-gartered, a fashion she detests;</div>
                     <div class="line">and he will smile upon her, which will now be so</div>
                     <div class="line">unsuitable to her disposition, being addicted to a</div>
                     <div class="line">melancholy as she is, that it cannot but turn him</div>
                     <div class="line">into a notable contempt. If you will see it, follow</div>
                     <div class="line">me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">To the gates of Tartar, thou most excellent devil of wit!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll make one too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.5">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 3. ACT III</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  OLIVIA's garden.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  OLIVIA's house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.4">3. SCENE III.  A street.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.5">4. SCENE IV.  OLIVIA's garden.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  OLIVIA's garden.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter VIOLA, and Clown with a tabour</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Save thee, friend, and thy music: dost thou live by</div>
                     <div class="line">thy tabour?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">No, sir, I live by the church.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou a churchman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">No such matter, sir: I do live by the church; for</div>
                     <div class="line">I do live at my house, and my house doth stand by</div>
                     <div class="line">the church.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">So thou mayst say, the king lies by a beggar, if a</div>
                     <div class="line">beggar dwell near him; or, the church stands by thy</div>
                     <div class="line">tabour, if thy tabour stand by the church.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">You have said, sir. To see this age! A sentence is</div>
                     <div class="line">but a cheveril glove to a good wit: how quickly the</div>
                     <div class="line">wrong side may be turned outward!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, that's certain; they that dally nicely with</div>
                     <div class="line">words may quickly make them wanton.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">I would, therefore, my sister had had no name, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, sir, her name's a word; and to dally with that</div>
                     <div class="line">word might make my sister wanton. But indeed words</div>
                     <div class="line">are very rascals since bonds disgraced them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy reason, man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Troth, sir, I can yield you none without words; and</div>
                     <div class="line">words are grown so false, I am loath to prove</div>
                     <div class="line">reason with them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I warrant thou art a merry fellow and carest for nothing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Not so, sir, I do care for something; but in my</div>
                     <div class="line">conscience, sir, I do not care for you: if that be</div>
                     <div class="line">to care for nothing, sir, I would it would make you invisible.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Art not thou the Lady Olivia's fool?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">No, indeed, sir; the Lady Olivia has no folly: she</div>
                     <div class="line">will keep no fool, sir, till she be married; and</div>
                     <div class="line">fools are as like husbands as pilchards are to</div>
                     <div class="line">herrings; the husband's the bigger: I am indeed not</div>
                     <div class="line">her fool, but her corrupter of words.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I saw thee late at the Count Orsino's.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Foolery, sir, does walk about the orb like the sun,</div>
                     <div class="line">it shines every where. I would be sorry, sir, but</div>
                     <div class="line">the fool should be as oft with your master as with</div>
                     <div class="line">my mistress: I think I saw your wisdom there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, an thou pass upon me, I'll no more with thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, there's expenses for thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Now Jove, in his next commodity of hair, send thee a beard!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, I'll tell thee, I am almost sick for</div>
                     <div class="line">one;</div>
                     <p>Aside</p>
                     <div class="line">though I would not have it grow on my chin. Is thy</div>
                     <div class="line">lady within?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Would not a pair of these have bred, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, being kept together and put to use.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">I would play Lord Pandarus of Phrygia, sir, to bring</div>
                     <div class="line">a Cressida to this Troilus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I understand you, sir; 'tis well begged.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">The matter, I hope, is not great, sir, begging but</div>
                     <div class="line">a beggar: Cressida was a beggar. My lady is</div>
                     <div class="line">within, sir. I will construe to them whence you</div>
                     <div class="line">come; who you are and what you would are out of my</div>
                     <div class="line">welkin, I might say 'element,' but the word is over-worn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">This fellow is wise enough to play the fool;</div>
                     <div class="line">And to do that well craves a kind of wit:</div>
                     <div class="line">He must observe their mood on whom he jests,</div>
                     <div class="line">The quality of persons, and the time,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, like the haggard, cheque at every feather</div>
                     <div class="line">That comes before his eye. This is a practise</div>
                     <div class="line">As full of labour as a wise man's art</div>
                     <div class="line">For folly that he wisely shows is fit;</div>
                     <div class="line">But wise men, folly-fall'n, quite taint their wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SIR TOBY BELCH, and SIR ANDREW</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Save you, gentleman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">And you, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Dieu vous garde, monsieur.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Et vous aussi; votre serviteur.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">I hope, sir, you are; and I am yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you encounter the house? my niece is desirous</div>
                     <div class="line">you should enter, if your trade be to her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I am bound to your niece, sir; I mean, she is the</div>
                     <div class="line">list of my voyage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Taste your legs, sir; put them to motion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">My legs do better understand me, sir, than I</div>
                     <div class="line">understand what you mean by bidding me taste my legs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean, to go, sir, to enter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I will answer you with gait and entrance. But we</div>
                     <div class="line">are prevented.</div>
                     <p>Enter OLIVIA and MARIA</p>
                     <div class="line">Most excellent accomplished lady, the heavens rain</div>
                     <div class="line">odours on you!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">That youth's a rare courtier: 'Rain odours;' well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">My matter hath no voice, to your own most pregnant</div>
                     <div class="line">and vouchsafed ear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">'Odours,' 'pregnant' and 'vouchsafed:' I'll get 'em</div>
                     <div class="line">all three all ready.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Let the garden door be shut, and leave me to my hearing.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt SIR TOBY BELCH, SIR ANDREW, and MARIA</p>
                     <div class="line">Give me your hand, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">My duty, madam, and most humble service.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What is your name?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Cesario is your servant's name, fair princess.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">My servant, sir! 'Twas never merry world</div>
                     <div class="line">Since lowly feigning was call'd compliment:</div>
                     <div class="line">You're servant to the Count Orsino, youth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">And he is yours, and his must needs be yours:</div>
                     <div class="line">Your servant's servant is your servant, madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">For him, I think not on him: for his thoughts,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would they were blanks, rather than fill'd with me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I come to whet your gentle thoughts</div>
                     <div class="line">On his behalf.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, by your leave, I pray you,</div>
                     <div class="line">I bade you never speak again of him:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, would you undertake another suit,</div>
                     <div class="line">I had rather hear you to solicit that</div>
                     <div class="line">Than music from the spheres.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Dear lady,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me leave, beseech you. I did send,</div>
                     <div class="line">After the last enchantment you did here,</div>
                     <div class="line">A ring in chase of you: so did I abuse</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself, my servant and, I fear me, you:</div>
                     <div class="line">Under your hard construction must I sit,</div>
                     <div class="line">To force that on you, in a shameful cunning,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which you knew none of yours: what might you think?</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you not set mine honour at the stake</div>
                     <div class="line">And baited it with all the unmuzzled thoughts</div>
                     <div class="line">That tyrannous heart can think? To one of your receiving</div>
                     <div class="line">Enough is shown: a cypress, not a bosom,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hideth my heart. So, let me hear you speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I pity you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">That's a degree to love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, not a grize; for 'tis a vulgar proof,</div>
                     <div class="line">That very oft we pity enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then, methinks 'tis time to smile again.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, world, how apt the poor are to be proud!</div>
                     <div class="line">If one should be a prey, how much the better</div>
                     <div class="line">To fall before the lion than the wolf!</div>
                     <p>Clock strikes</p>
                     <div class="line">The clock upbraids me with the waste of time.</div>
                     <div class="line">Be not afraid, good youth, I will not have you:</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet, when wit and youth is come to harvest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your were is alike to reap a proper man:</div>
                     <div class="line">There lies your way, due west.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Then westward-ho! Grace and good disposition</div>
                     <div class="line">Attend your ladyship!</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll nothing, madam, to my lord by me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay:</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, tell me what thou thinkest of me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">That you do think you are not what you are.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">If I think so, I think the same of you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Then think you right: I am not what I am.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I would you were as I would have you be!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Would it be better, madam, than I am?</div>
                     <div class="line">I wish it might, for now I am your fool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, what a deal of scorn looks beautiful</div>
                     <div class="line">In the contempt and anger of his lip!</div>
                     <div class="line">A murderous guilt shows not itself more soon</div>
                     <div class="line">Than love that would seem hid: love's night is noon.</div>
                     <div class="line">Cesario, by the roses of the spring,</div>
                     <div class="line">By maidhood, honour, truth and every thing,</div>
                     <div class="line">I love thee so, that, maugre all thy pride,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor wit nor reason can my passion hide.</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not extort thy reasons from this clause,</div>
                     <div class="line">For that I woo, thou therefore hast no cause,</div>
                     <div class="line">But rather reason thus with reason fetter,</div>
                     <div class="line">Love sought is good, but given unsought better.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">By innocence I swear, and by my youth</div>
                     <div class="line">I have one heart, one bosom and one truth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that no woman has; nor never none</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall mistress be of it, save I alone.</div>
                     <div class="line">And so adieu, good madam: never more</div>
                     <div class="line">Will I my master's tears to you deplore.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet come again; for thou perhaps mayst move</div>
                     <div class="line">That heart, which now abhors, to like his love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  OLIVIA's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SIR TOBY BELCH, SIR ANDREW, and FABIAN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">No, faith, I'll not stay a jot longer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy reason, dear venom, give thy reason.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">You must needs yield your reason, Sir Andrew.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, I saw your niece do more favours to the</div>
                     <div class="line">count's serving-man than ever she bestowed upon me;</div>
                     <div class="line">I saw't i' the orchard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Did she see thee the while, old boy? tell me that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">As plain as I see you now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">This was a great argument of love in her toward you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">'Slight, will you make an ass o' me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I will prove it legitimate, sir, upon the oaths of</div>
                     <div class="line">judgment and reason.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">And they have been grand-jury-men since before Noah</div>
                     <div class="line">was a sailor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">She did show favour to the youth in your sight only</div>
                     <div class="line">to exasperate you, to awake your dormouse valour, to</div>
                     <div class="line">put fire in your heart and brimstone in your liver.</div>
                     <div class="line">You should then have accosted her; and with some</div>
                     <div class="line">excellent jests, fire-new from the mint, you should</div>
                     <div class="line">have banged the youth into dumbness. This was</div>
                     <div class="line">looked for at your hand, and this was balked: the</div>
                     <div class="line">double gilt of this opportunity you let time wash</div>
                     <div class="line">off, and you are now sailed into the north of my</div>
                     <div class="line">lady's opinion; where you will hang like an icicle</div>
                     <div class="line">on a Dutchman's beard, unless you do redeem it by</div>
                     <div class="line">some laudable attempt either of valour or policy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">An't be any way, it must be with valour; for policy</div>
                     <div class="line">I hate: I had as lief be a Brownist as a</div>
                     <div class="line">politician.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then, build me thy fortunes upon the basis of</div>
                     <div class="line">valour. Challenge me the count's youth to fight</div>
                     <div class="line">with him; hurt him in eleven places: my niece shall</div>
                     <div class="line">take note of it; and assure thyself, there is no</div>
                     <div class="line">love-broker in the world can more prevail in man's</div>
                     <div class="line">commendation with woman than report of valour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no way but this, Sir Andrew.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Will either of you bear me a challenge to him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, write it in a martial hand; be curst and brief;</div>
                     <div class="line">it is no matter how witty, so it be eloquent and fun</div>
                     <div class="line">of invention: taunt him with the licence of ink:</div>
                     <div class="line">if thou thou'st him some thrice, it shall not be</div>
                     <div class="line">amiss; and as many lies as will lie in thy sheet of</div>
                     <div class="line">paper, although the sheet were big enough for the</div>
                     <div class="line">bed of Ware in England, set 'em down: go, about it.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let there be gall enough in thy ink, though thou</div>
                     <div class="line">write with a goose-pen, no matter: about it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Where shall I find you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll call thee at the cubiculo: go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit SIR ANDREW</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">This is a dear manikin to you, Sir Toby.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">I have been dear to him, lad, some two thousand</div>
                     <div class="line">strong, or so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">We shall have a rare letter from him: but you'll</div>
                     <div class="line">not deliver't?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Never trust me, then; and by all means stir on the</div>
                     <div class="line">youth to an answer. I think oxen and wainropes</div>
                     <div class="line">cannot hale them together. For Andrew, if he were</div>
                     <div class="line">opened, and you find so much blood in his liver as</div>
                     <div class="line">will clog the foot of a flea, I'll eat the rest of</div>
                     <div class="line">the anatomy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">And his opposite, the youth, bears in his visage no</div>
                     <div class="line">great presage of cruelty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter MARIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, where the youngest wren of nine comes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">If you desire the spleen, and will laugh yourself</div>
                     <div class="line">into stitches, follow me. Yond gull Malvolio is</div>
                     <div class="line">turned heathen, a very renegado; for there is no</div>
                     <div class="line">Christian, that means to be saved by believing</div>
                     <div class="line">rightly, can ever believe such impossible passages</div>
                     <div class="line">of grossness. He's in yellow stockings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">And cross-gartered?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Most villanously; like a pedant that keeps a school</div>
                     <div class="line">i' the church. I have dogged him, like his</div>
                     <div class="line">murderer. He does obey every point of the letter</div>
                     <div class="line">that I dropped to betray him: he does smile his</div>
                     <div class="line">face into more lines than is in the new map with the</div>
                     <div class="line">augmentation of the Indies: you have not seen such</div>
                     <div class="line">a thing as 'tis. I can hardly forbear hurling things</div>
                     <div class="line">at him. I know my lady will strike him: if she do,</div>
                     <div class="line">he'll smile and take't for a great favour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, bring us, bring us where he is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  A street.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SEBASTIAN and ANTONIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not by my will have troubled you;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, since you make your pleasure of your pains,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will no further chide you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I could not stay behind you: my desire,</div>
                     <div class="line">More sharp than filed steel, did spur me forth;</div>
                     <div class="line">And not all love to see you, though so much</div>
                     <div class="line">As might have drawn one to a longer voyage,</div>
                     <div class="line">But jealousy what might befall your travel,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being skilless in these parts; which to a stranger,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unguided and unfriended, often prove</div>
                     <div class="line">Rough and unhospitable: my willing love,</div>
                     <div class="line">The rather by these arguments of fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Set forth in your pursuit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">My kind Antonio,</div>
                     <div class="line">I can no other answer make but thanks,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thanks; and ever oft good turns</div>
                     <div class="line">Are shuffled off with such uncurrent pay:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, were my worth as is my conscience firm,</div>
                     <div class="line">You should find better dealing. What's to do?</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall we go see the reliques of this town?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow, sir: best first go see your lodging.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not weary, and 'tis long to night:</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, let us satisfy our eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">With the memorials and the things of fame</div>
                     <div class="line">That do renown this city.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Would you'ld pardon me;</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not without danger walk these streets:</div>
                     <div class="line">Once, in a sea-fight, 'gainst the count his galleys</div>
                     <div class="line">I did some service; of such note indeed,</div>
                     <div class="line">That were I ta'en here it would scarce be answer'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Belike you slew great number of his people.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">The offence is not of such a bloody nature;</div>
                     <div class="line">Albeit the quality of the time and quarrel</div>
                     <div class="line">Might well have given us bloody argument.</div>
                     <div class="line">It might have since been answer'd in repaying</div>
                     <div class="line">What we took from them; which, for traffic's sake,</div>
                     <div class="line">Most of our city did: only myself stood out;</div>
                     <div class="line">For which, if I be lapsed in this place,</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall pay dear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not then walk too open.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">It doth not fit me. Hold, sir, here's my purse.</div>
                     <div class="line">In the south suburbs, at the Elephant,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is best to lodge: I will bespeak our diet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whiles you beguile the time and feed your knowledge</div>
                     <div class="line">With viewing of the town: there shall you have me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Why I your purse?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
