                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Haply your eye shall light upon some toy</div>
                     <div class="line">You have desire to purchase; and your store,</div>
                     <div class="line">I think, is not for idle markets, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be your purse-bearer and leave you</div>
                     <div class="line">For an hour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">To the Elephant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I do remember.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  OLIVIA's garden.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter OLIVIA and MARIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I have sent after him: he says he'll come;</div>
                     <div class="line">How shall I feast him? what bestow of him?</div>
                     <div class="line">For youth is bought more oft than begg'd or borrow'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">I speak too loud.</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is Malvolio? he is sad and civil,</div>
                     <div class="line">And suits well for a servant with my fortunes:</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is Malvolio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">He's coming, madam; but in very strange manner. He</div>
                     <div class="line">is, sure, possessed, madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what's the matter? does he rave?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">No. madam, he does nothing but smile: your</div>
                     <div class="line">ladyship were best to have some guard about you, if</div>
                     <div class="line">he come; for, sure, the man is tainted in's wits.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Go call him hither.</div>
                     <p>Exit MARIA</p>
                     <div class="line">I am as mad as he,</div>
                     <div class="line">If sad and merry madness equal be.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter MARIA, with MALVOLIO</p>
                     <div class="line">How now, Malvolio!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet lady, ho, ho.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Smilest thou?</div>
                     <div class="line">I sent for thee upon a sad occasion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sad, lady! I could be sad: this does make some</div>
                     <div class="line">obstruction in the blood, this cross-gartering; but</div>
                     <div class="line">what of that? if it please the eye of one, it is</div>
                     <div class="line">with me as the very true sonnet is, 'Please one, and</div>
                     <div class="line">please all.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, how dost thou, man? what is the matter with thee?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Not black in my mind, though yellow in my legs. It</div>
                     <div class="line">did come to his hands, and commands shall be</div>
                     <div class="line">executed: I think we do know the sweet Roman hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou go to bed, Malvolio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">To bed! ay, sweet-heart, and I'll come to thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">God comfort thee! Why dost thou smile so and kiss</div>
                     <div class="line">thy hand so oft?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">How do you, Malvolio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">At your request! yes; nightingales answer daws.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why appear you with this ridiculous boldness before my lady?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Be not afraid of greatness:' 'twas well writ.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What meanest thou by that, Malvolio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Some are born great,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Some achieve greatness,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What sayest thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'And some have greatness thrust upon them.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven restore thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Remember who commended thy yellow stockings,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy yellow stockings!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'And wished to see thee cross-gartered.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Cross-gartered!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Go to thou art made, if thou desirest to be so;'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Am I made?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'If not, let me see thee a servant still.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, this is very midsummer madness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Servant</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, the young gentleman of the Count Orsino's is</div>
                     <div class="line">returned: I could hardly entreat him back: he</div>
                     <div class="line">attends your ladyship's pleasure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll come to him.</div>
                     <p>Exit Servant</p>
                     <div class="line">Good Maria, let this fellow be looked to. Where's</div>
                     <div class="line">my cousin Toby? Let some of my people have a special</div>
                     <div class="line">care of him: I would not have him miscarry for the</div>
                     <div class="line">half of my dowry.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt OLIVIA and MARIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, ho! do you come near me now? no worse man than</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Toby to look to me! This concurs directly with</div>
                     <div class="line">the letter: she sends him on purpose, that I may</div>
                     <div class="line">appear stubborn to him; for she incites me to that</div>
                     <div class="line">in the letter. 'Cast thy humble slough,' says she;</div>
                     <div class="line">'be opposite with a kinsman, surly with servants;</div>
                     <div class="line">let thy tongue tang with arguments of state; put</div>
                     <div class="line">thyself into the trick of singularity;' and</div>
                     <div class="line">consequently sets down the manner how; as, a sad</div>
                     <div class="line">face, a reverend carriage, a slow tongue, in the</div>
                     <div class="line">habit of some sir of note, and so forth. I have</div>
                     <div class="line">limed her; but it is Jove's doing, and Jove make me</div>
                     <div class="line">thankful! And when she went away now, 'Let this</div>
                     <div class="line">fellow be looked to:' fellow! not Malvolio, nor</div>
                     <div class="line">after my degree, but fellow. Why, every thing</div>
                     <div class="line">adheres together, that no dram of a scruple, no</div>
                     <div class="line">scruple of a scruple, no obstacle, no incredulous</div>
                     <div class="line">or unsafe circumstance--What can be said? Nothing</div>
                     <div class="line">that can be can come between me and the full</div>
                     <div class="line">prospect of my hopes. Well, Jove, not I, is the</div>
                     <div class="line">doer of this, and he is to be thanked.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter MARIA, with SIR TOBY BELCH and FABIAN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Which way is he, in the name of sanctity? If all</div>
                     <div class="line">the devils of hell be drawn in little, and Legion</div>
                     <div class="line">himself possessed him, yet I'll speak to him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Here he is, here he is. How is't with you, sir?</div>
                     <div class="line">how is't with you, man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Go off; I discard you: let me enjoy my private: go</div>
                     <div class="line">off.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Lo, how hollow the fiend speaks within him! did not</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell you? Sir Toby, my lady prays you to have a</div>
                     <div class="line">care of him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, ha! does she so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to, go to; peace, peace; we must deal gently</div>
                     <div class="line">with him: let me alone. How do you, Malvolio? how</div>
                     <div class="line">is't with you? What, man! defy the devil:</div>
                     <div class="line">consider, he's an enemy to mankind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you know what you say?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">La you, an you speak ill of the devil, how he takes</div>
                     <div class="line">it at heart! Pray God, he be not bewitched!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Carry his water to the wise woman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, and it shall be done to-morrow morning, if I</div>
                     <div class="line">live. My lady would not lose him for more than I'll say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, mistress!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Prithee, hold thy peace; this is not the way: do</div>
                     <div class="line">you not see you move him? let me alone with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">No way but gentleness; gently, gently: the fiend is</div>
                     <div class="line">rough, and will not be roughly used.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, how now, my bawcock! how dost thou, chuck?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, Biddy, come with me. What, man! 'tis not for</div>
                     <div class="line">gravity to play at cherry-pit with Satan: hang</div>
                     <div class="line">him, foul collier!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Get him to say his prayers, good Sir Toby, get him to pray.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">My prayers, minx!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I warrant you, he will not hear of godliness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, hang yourselves all! you are idle shallow</div>
                     <div class="line">things: I am not of your element: you shall know</div>
                     <div class="line">more hereafter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't possible?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">If this were played upon a stage now, I could</div>
                     <div class="line">condemn it as an improbable fiction.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">His very genius hath taken the infection of the device, man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, pursue him now, lest the device take air and taint.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, we shall make him mad indeed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">The house will be the quieter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, we'll have him in a dark room and bound. My</div>
                     <div class="line">niece is already in the belief that he's mad: we</div>
                     <div class="line">may carry it thus, for our pleasure and his penance,</div>
                     <div class="line">till our very pastime, tired out of breath, prompt</div>
                     <div class="line">us to have mercy on him: at which time we will</div>
                     <div class="line">bring the device to the bar and crown thee for a</div>
                     <div class="line">finder of madmen. But see, but see.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SIR ANDREW</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">More matter for a May morning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's the challenge, read it: warrant there's</div>
                     <div class="line">vinegar and pepper in't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't so saucy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, is't, I warrant him: do but read.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me.</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'Youth, whatsoever thou art, thou art but a scurvy fellow.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Good, and valiant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'Wonder not, nor admire not in thy mind,</div>
                     <div class="line">why I do call thee so, for I will show thee no reason for't.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">A good note; that keeps you from the blow of the law.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'Thou comest to the lady Olivia, and in my</div>
                     <div class="line">sight she uses thee kindly: but thou liest in thy</div>
                     <div class="line">throat; that is not the matter I challenge thee for.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Very brief, and to exceeding good sense--less.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'I will waylay thee going home; where if it</div>
                     <div class="line">be thy chance to kill me,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'Thou killest me like a rogue and a villain.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Still you keep o' the windy side of the law: good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'Fare thee well; and God have mercy upon</div>
                     <div class="line">one of our souls! He may have mercy upon mine; but</div>
                     <div class="line">my hope is better, and so look to thyself. Thy</div>
                     <div class="line">friend, as thou usest him, and thy sworn enemy,</div>
                     <div class="line">ANDREW AGUECHEEK.</div>
                     <div class="line">If this letter move him not, his legs cannot:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll give't him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">You may have very fit occasion for't: he is now in</div>
                     <div class="line">some commerce with my lady, and will by and by depart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, Sir Andrew: scout me for him at the corner the</div>
                     <div class="line">orchard like a bum-baily: so soon as ever thou seest</div>
                     <div class="line">him, draw; and, as thou drawest swear horrible; for</div>
                     <div class="line">it comes to pass oft that a terrible oath, with a</div>
                     <div class="line">swaggering accent sharply twanged off, gives manhood</div>
                     <div class="line">more approbation than ever proof itself would have</div>
                     <div class="line">earned him. Away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, let me alone for swearing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Now will not I deliver his letter: for the behavior</div>
                     <div class="line">of the young gentleman gives him out to be of good</div>
                     <div class="line">capacity and breeding; his employment between his</div>
                     <div class="line">lord and my niece confirms no less: therefore this</div>
                     <div class="line">letter, being so excellently ignorant, will breed no</div>
                     <div class="line">terror in the youth: he will find it comes from a</div>
                     <div class="line">clodpole. But, sir, I will deliver his challenge by</div>
                     <div class="line">word of mouth; set upon Aguecheek a notable report</div>
                     <div class="line">of valour; and drive the gentleman, as I know his</div>
                     <div class="line">youth will aptly receive it, into a most hideous</div>
                     <div class="line">opinion of his rage, skill, fury and impetuosity.</div>
                     <div class="line">This will so fright them both that they will kill</div>
                     <div class="line">one another by the look, like cockatrices.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter OLIVIA, with VIOLA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Here he comes with your niece: give them way till</div>
                     <div class="line">he take leave, and presently after him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">I will meditate the while upon some horrid message</div>
                     <div class="line">for a challenge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt SIR TOBY BELCH, FABIAN, and MARIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I have said too much unto a heart of stone</div>
                     <div class="line">And laid mine honour too unchary out:</div>
                     <div class="line">There's something in me that reproves my fault;</div>
                     <div class="line">But such a headstrong potent fault it is,</div>
                     <div class="line">That it but mocks reproof.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">With the same 'havior that your passion bears</div>
                     <div class="line">Goes on my master's grief.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, wear this jewel for me, 'tis my picture;</div>
                     <div class="line">Refuse it not; it hath no tongue to vex you;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I beseech you come again to-morrow.</div>
                     <div class="line">What shall you ask of me that I'll deny,</div>
                     <div class="line">That honour saved may upon asking give?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing but this; your true love for my master.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">How with mine honour may I give him that</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I have given to you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I will acquit you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, come again to-morrow: fare thee well:</div>
                     <div class="line">A fiend like thee might bear my soul to hell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Re-enter SIR TOBY BELCH and FABIAN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentleman, God save thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">And you, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">That defence thou hast, betake thee to't: of what</div>
                     <div class="line">nature the wrongs are thou hast done him, I know</div>
                     <div class="line">not; but thy intercepter, full of despite, bloody as</div>
                     <div class="line">the hunter, attends thee at the orchard-end:</div>
                     <div class="line">dismount thy tuck, be yare in thy preparation, for</div>
                     <div class="line">thy assailant is quick, skilful and deadly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">You mistake, sir; I am sure no man hath any quarrel</div>
                     <div class="line">to me: my remembrance is very free and clear from</div>
                     <div class="line">any image of offence done to any man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll find it otherwise, I assure you: therefore,</div>
                     <div class="line">if you hold your life at any price, betake you to</div>
                     <div class="line">your guard; for your opposite hath in him what</div>
                     <div class="line">youth, strength, skill and wrath can furnish man withal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, sir, what is he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">He is knight, dubbed with unhatched rapier and on</div>
                     <div class="line">carpet consideration; but he is a devil in private</div>
                     <div class="line">brawl: souls and bodies hath he divorced three; and</div>
                     <div class="line">his incensement at this moment is so implacable,</div>
                     <div class="line">that satisfaction can be none but by pangs of death</div>
                     <div class="line">and sepulchre. Hob, nob, is his word; give't or take't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I will return again into the house and desire some</div>
                     <div class="line">conduct of the lady. I am no fighter. I have heard</div>
                     <div class="line">of some kind of men that put quarrels purposely on</div>
                     <div class="line">others, to taste their valour: belike this is a man</div>
                     <div class="line">of that quirk.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, no; his indignation derives itself out of a</div>
                     <div class="line">very competent injury: therefore, get you on and</div>
                     <div class="line">give him his desire. Back you shall not to the</div>
                     <div class="line">house, unless you undertake that with me which with</div>
                     <div class="line">as much safety you might answer him: therefore, on,</div>
                     <div class="line">or strip your sword stark naked; for meddle you</div>
                     <div class="line">must, that's certain, or forswear to wear iron about you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">This is as uncivil as strange. I beseech you, do me</div>
                     <div class="line">this courteous office, as to know of the knight what</div>
                     <div class="line">my offence to him is: it is something of my</div>
                     <div class="line">negligence, nothing of my purpose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">I will do so. Signior Fabian, stay you by this</div>
                     <div class="line">gentleman till my return.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, sir, do you know of this matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I know the knight is incensed against you, even to a</div>
                     <div class="line">mortal arbitrement; but nothing of the circumstance more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I beseech you, what manner of man is he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing of that wonderful promise, to read him by</div>
                     <div class="line">his form, as you are like to find him in the proof</div>
                     <div class="line">of his valour. He is, indeed, sir, the most skilful,</div>
                     <div class="line">bloody and fatal opposite that you could possibly</div>
                     <div class="line">have found in any part of Illyria. Will you walk</div>
                     <div class="line">towards him? I will make your peace with him if I</div>
                     <div class="line">can.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall be much bound to you for't: I am one that</div>
                     <div class="line">had rather go with sir priest than sir knight: I</div>
                     <div class="line">care not who knows so much of my mettle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
               <p>Re-enter SIR TOBY BELCH, with SIR ANDREW</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, man, he's a very devil; I have not seen such a</div>
                     <div class="line">firago. I had a pass with him, rapier, scabbard and</div>
                     <div class="line">all, and he gives me the stuck in with such a mortal</div>
                     <div class="line">motion, that it is inevitable; and on the answer, he</div>
                     <div class="line">pays you as surely as your feet hit the ground they</div>
                     <div class="line">step on. They say he has been fencer to the Sophy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Pox on't, I'll not meddle with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but he will not now be pacified: Fabian can</div>
                     <div class="line">scarce hold him yonder.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Plague on't, an I thought he had been valiant and so</div>
                     <div class="line">cunning in fence, I'ld have seen him damned ere I'ld</div>
                     <div class="line">have challenged him. Let him let the matter slip,</div>
                     <div class="line">and I'll give him my horse, grey Capilet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll make the motion: stand here, make a good show</div>
                     <div class="line">on't: this shall end without the perdition of souls.</div>
                     <p>Aside</p>
                     <div class="line">Marry, I'll ride your horse as well as I ride you.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter FABIAN and VIOLA</p>
                     <p>To FABIAN</p>
                     <div class="line">I have his horse to take up the quarrel:</div>
                     <div class="line">I have persuaded him the youth's a devil.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">He is as horribly conceited of him; and pants and</div>
                     <div class="line">looks pale, as if a bear were at his heels.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To VIOLA</span>  There's no remedy, sir; he will fight</div>
                     <div class="line">with you for's oath sake: marry, he hath better</div>
                     <div class="line">bethought him of his quarrel, and he finds that now</div>
                     <div class="line">scarce to be worth talking of: therefore draw, for</div>
                     <div class="line">the supportance of his vow; he protests he will not hurt you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Pray God defend me! A little thing would</div>
                     <div class="line">make me tell them how much I lack of a man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Give ground, if you see him furious.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, Sir Andrew, there's no remedy; the gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">will, for his honour's sake, have one bout with you;</div>
                     <div class="line">he cannot by the duello avoid it: but he has</div>
                     <div class="line">promised me, as he is a gentleman and a soldier, he</div>
                     <div class="line">will not hurt you. Come on; to't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray God, he keep his oath!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I do assure you, 'tis against my will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>They draw</p>
               <p>Enter ANTONIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Put up your sword. If this young gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Have done offence, I take the fault on me:</div>
                     <div class="line">If you offend him, I for him defy you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">You, sir! why, what are you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">One, sir, that for his love dares yet do more</div>
                     <div class="line">Than you have heard him brag to you he will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, if you be an undertaker, I am for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>They draw</p>
               <p>Enter Officers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">O good Sir Toby, hold! here come the officers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be with you anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray, sir, put your sword up, if you please.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, will I, sir; and, for that I promised you,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be as good as my word: he will bear you easily</div>
                     <div class="line">and reins well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Officer</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the man; do thy office.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Officer</div>
                     <div class="line">Antonio, I arrest thee at the suit of Count Orsino.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">You do mistake me, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Officer</div>
                     <div class="line">No, sir, no jot; I know your favour well,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though now you have no sea-cap on your head.</div>
                     <div class="line">Take him away: he knows I know him well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I must obey.</div>
                     <p>To VIOLA</p>
                     <div class="line">This comes with seeking you:</div>
                     <div class="line">But there's no remedy; I shall answer it.</div>
                     <div class="line">What will you do, now my necessity</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes me to ask you for my purse? It grieves me</div>
                     <div class="line">Much more for what I cannot do for you</div>
                     <div class="line">Than what befalls myself. You stand amazed;</div>
                     <div class="line">But be of comfort.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Officer</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, sir, away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I must entreat of you some of that money.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">What money, sir?</div>
                     <div class="line">For the fair kindness you have show'd me here,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, part, being prompted by your present trouble,</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of my lean and low ability</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll lend you something: my having is not much;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll make division of my present with you:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, there's half my coffer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you deny me now?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't possible that my deserts to you</div>
                     <div class="line">Can lack persuasion? Do not tempt my misery,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest that it make me so unsound a man</div>
                     <div class="line">As to upbraid you with those kindnesses</div>
                     <div class="line">That I have done for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I know of none;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor know I you by voice or any feature:</div>
                     <div class="line">I hate ingratitude more in a man</div>
                     <div class="line">Than lying, vainness, babbling, drunkenness,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or any taint of vice whose strong corruption</div>
                     <div class="line">Inhabits our frail blood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O heavens themselves!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Officer</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, sir, I pray you, go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me speak a little. This youth that you see here</div>
                     <div class="line">I snatch'd one half out of the jaws of death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Relieved him with such sanctity of love,</div>
                     <div class="line">And to his image, which methought did promise</div>
                     <div class="line">Most venerable worth, did I devotion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Officer</div>
                     <div class="line">What's that to us? The time goes by: away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">But O how vile an idol proves this god</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast, Sebastian, done good feature shame.</div>
                     <div class="line">In nature there's no blemish but the mind;</div>
                     <div class="line">None can be call'd deform'd but the unkind:</div>
                     <div class="line">Virtue is beauty, but the beauteous evil</div>
                     <div class="line">Are empty trunks o'erflourish'd by the devil.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Officer</div>
                     <div class="line">The man grows mad: away with him! Come, come, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Lead me on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit with Officers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks his words do from such passion fly,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he believes himself: so do not I.</div>
                     <div class="line">Prove true, imagination, O, prove true,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I, dear brother, be now ta'en for you!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, knight; come hither, Fabian: we'll</div>
                     <div class="line">whisper o'er a couplet or two of most sage saws.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">He named Sebastian: I my brother know</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet living in my glass; even such and so</div>
                     <div class="line">In favour was my brother, and he went</div>
                     <div class="line">Still in this fashion, colour, ornament,</div>
                     <div class="line">For him I imitate: O, if it prove,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tempests are kind and salt waves fresh in love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">A very dishonest paltry boy, and more a coward than</div>
                     <div class="line">a hare: his dishonesty appears in leaving his</div>
                     <div class="line">friend here in necessity and denying him; and for</div>
                     <div class="line">his cowardship, ask Fabian.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">A coward, a most devout coward, religious in it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">'Slid, I'll after him again and beat him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Do; cuff him soundly, but never draw thy sword.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">An I do not,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, let's see the event.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">I dare lay any money 'twill be nothing yet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  Before OLIVIA's house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  OLIVIA's house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  OLIVIA's garden.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Before OLIVIA's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SEBASTIAN and Clown</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you make me believe that I am not sent for you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to, go to, thou art a foolish fellow:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me be clear of thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Well held out, i' faith! No, I do not know you; nor</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not sent to you by my lady, to bid you come</div>
                     <div class="line">speak with her; nor your name is not Master Cesario;</div>
                     <div class="line">nor this is not my nose neither. Nothing that is so is so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, vent thy folly somewhere else: Thou</div>
                     <div class="line">know'st not me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Vent my folly! he has heard that word of some</div>
                     <div class="line">great man and now applies it to a fool. Vent my</div>
                     <div class="line">folly! I am afraid this great lubber, the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">will prove a cockney. I prithee now, ungird thy</div>
                     <div class="line">strangeness and tell me what I shall vent to my</div>
                     <div class="line">lady: shall I vent to her that thou art coming?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, foolish Greek, depart from me: There's</div>
                     <div class="line">money for thee: if you tarry longer, I shall give</div>
                     <div class="line">worse payment.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, thou hast an open hand. These wise men</div>
                     <div class="line">that give fools money get themselves a good</div>
                     <div class="line">report--after fourteen years' purchase.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SIR ANDREW, SIR TOBY BELCH, and FABIAN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, sir, have I met you again? there's for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, there's for thee, and there, and there. Are all</div>
                     <div class="line">the people mad?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, sir, or I'll throw your dagger o'er the house.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">This will I tell my lady straight: I would not be</div>
                     <div class="line">in some of your coats for two pence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Come on, sir; hold.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, let him alone: I'll go another way to work</div>
                     <div class="line">with him; I'll have an action of battery against</div>
                     <div class="line">him, if there be any law in Illyria: though I</div>
                     <div class="line">struck him first, yet it's no matter for that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Let go thy hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, sir, I will not let you go. Come, my young</div>
                     <div class="line">soldier, put up your iron: you are well fleshed; come on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I will be free from thee. What wouldst thou now? If</div>
                     <div class="line">thou darest tempt me further, draw thy sword.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">What, what? Nay, then I must have an ounce or two</div>
                     <div class="line">of this malapert blood from you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter OLIVIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, Toby; on thy life I charge thee, hold!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Will it be ever thus? Ungracious wretch,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fit for the mountains and the barbarous caves,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where manners ne'er were preach'd! out of my sight!</div>
                     <div class="line">Be not offended, dear Cesario.</div>
                     <div class="line">Rudesby, be gone!</div>
                     <p>Exeunt SIR TOBY BELCH, SIR ANDREW, and FABIAN</p>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, gentle friend,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let thy fair wisdom, not thy passion, sway</div>
                     <div class="line">In this uncivil and thou unjust extent</div>
                     <div class="line">Against thy peace. Go with me to my house,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hear thou there how many fruitless pranks</div>
                     <div class="line">This ruffian hath botch'd up, that thou thereby</div>
                     <div class="line">Mayst smile at this: thou shalt not choose but go:</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not deny. Beshrew his soul for me,</div>
                     <div class="line">He started one poor heart of mine in thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">What relish is in this? how runs the stream?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or I am mad, or else this is a dream:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let fancy still my sense in Lethe steep;</div>
                     <div class="line">If it be thus to dream, still let me sleep!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, come, I prithee; would thou'ldst be ruled by me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, say so, and so be!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  OLIVIA's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter MARIA and Clown</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I prithee, put on this gown and this beard;</div>
                     <div class="line">make him believe thou art Sir Topas the curate: do</div>
                     <div class="line">it quickly; I'll call Sir Toby the whilst.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I'll put it on, and I will dissemble myself</div>
                     <div class="line">in't; and I would I were the first that ever</div>
                     <div class="line">dissembled in such a gown. I am not tall enough to</div>
                     <div class="line">become the function well, nor lean enough to be</div>
                     <div class="line">thought a good student; but to be said an honest man</div>
                     <div class="line">and a good housekeeper goes as fairly as to say a</div>
                     <div class="line">careful man and a great scholar. The competitors enter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SIR TOBY BELCH and MARIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Jove bless thee, master Parson.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Bonos dies, Sir Toby: for, as the old hermit of</div>
                     <div class="line">Prague, that never saw pen and ink, very wittily</div>
                     <div class="line">said to a niece of King Gorboduc, 'That that is is;'</div>
                     <div class="line">so I, being Master Parson, am Master Parson; for,</div>
                     <div class="line">what is 'that' but 'that,' and 'is' but 'is'?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">To him, Sir Topas.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">What, ho, I say! peace in this prison!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">The knave counterfeits well; a good knave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Who calls there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Topas the curate, who comes to visit Malvolio</div>
                     <div class="line">the lunatic.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Topas, Sir Topas, good Sir Topas, go to my lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, hyperbolical fiend! how vexest thou this man!</div>
