                     <div class="line">talkest thou nothing but of ladies?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Well said, Master Parson.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Topas, never was man thus wronged: good Sir</div>
                     <div class="line">Topas, do not think I am mad: they have laid me</div>
                     <div class="line">here in hideous darkness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, thou dishonest Satan! I call thee by the most</div>
                     <div class="line">modest terms; for I am one of those gentle ones</div>
                     <div class="line">that will use the devil himself with courtesy:</div>
                     <div class="line">sayest thou that house is dark?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">As hell, Sir Topas.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Why it hath bay windows transparent as barricadoes,</div>
                     <div class="line">and the clearstores toward the south north are as</div>
                     <div class="line">lustrous as ebony; and yet complainest thou of</div>
                     <div class="line">obstruction?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not mad, Sir Topas: I say to you, this house is dark.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Madman, thou errest: I say, there is no darkness</div>
                     <div class="line">but ignorance; in which thou art more puzzled than</div>
                     <div class="line">the Egyptians in their fog.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I say, this house is as dark as ignorance, though</div>
                     <div class="line">ignorance were as dark as hell; and I say, there</div>
                     <div class="line">was never man thus abused. I am no more mad than you</div>
                     <div class="line">are: make the trial of it in any constant question.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">What is the opinion of Pythagoras concerning wild fowl?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">That the soul of our grandam might haply inhabit a bird.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">What thinkest thou of his opinion?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I think nobly of the soul, and no way approve his opinion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Fare thee well. Remain thou still in darkness:</div>
                     <div class="line">thou shalt hold the opinion of Pythagoras ere I will</div>
                     <div class="line">allow of thy wits, and fear to kill a woodcock, lest</div>
                     <div class="line">thou dispossess the soul of thy grandam. Fare thee well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Topas, Sir Topas!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">My most exquisite Sir Topas!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I am for all waters.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou mightst have done this without thy beard and</div>
                     <div class="line">gown: he sees thee not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">To him in thine own voice, and bring me word how</div>
                     <div class="line">thou findest him: I would we were well rid of this</div>
                     <div class="line">knavery. If he may be conveniently delivered, I</div>
                     <div class="line">would he were, for I am now so far in offence with</div>
                     <div class="line">my niece that I cannot pursue with any safety this</div>
                     <div class="line">sport to the upshot. Come by and by to my chamber.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt SIR TOBY BELCH and MARIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Singing</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">'Hey, Robin, jolly Robin,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me how thy lady does.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Fool!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">'My lady is unkind, perdy.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Fool!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">'Alas, why is she so?'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Fool, I say!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">'She loves another'--Who calls, ha?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Good fool, as ever thou wilt deserve well at my</div>
                     <div class="line">hand, help me to a candle, and pen, ink and paper:</div>
                     <div class="line">as I am a gentleman, I will live to be thankful to</div>
                     <div class="line">thee for't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Master Malvolio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, good fool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, sir, how fell you besides your five wits?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Fool, there was never a man so notoriously abused: I</div>
                     <div class="line">am as well in my wits, fool, as thou art.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">But as well? then you are mad indeed, if you be no</div>
                     <div class="line">better in your wits than a fool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">They have here propertied me; keep me in darkness,</div>
                     <div class="line">send ministers to me, asses, and do all they can to</div>
                     <div class="line">face me out of my wits.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Advise you what you say; the minister is here.</div>
                     <div class="line">Malvolio, Malvolio, thy wits the heavens restore!</div>
                     <div class="line">endeavour thyself to sleep, and leave thy vain</div>
                     <div class="line">bibble babble.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Topas!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Maintain no words with him, good fellow. Who, I,</div>
                     <div class="line">sir? not I, sir. God be wi' you, good Sir Topas.</div>
                     <div class="line">Merry, amen. I will, sir, I will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Fool, fool, fool, I say!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, sir, be patient. What say you sir? I am</div>
                     <div class="line">shent for speaking to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Good fool, help me to some light and some paper: I</div>
                     <div class="line">tell thee, I am as well in my wits as any man in Illyria.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Well-a-day that you were, sir</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">By this hand, I am. Good fool, some ink, paper and</div>
                     <div class="line">light; and convey what I will set down to my lady:</div>
                     <div class="line">it shall advantage thee more than ever the bearing</div>
                     <div class="line">of letter did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">I will help you to't. But tell me true, are you</div>
                     <div class="line">not mad indeed? or do you but counterfeit?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Believe me, I am not; I tell thee true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I'll ne'er believe a madman till I see his</div>
                     <div class="line">brains. I will fetch you light and paper and ink.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Fool, I'll requite it in the highest degree: I</div>
                     <div class="line">prithee, be gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Singing</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">I am gone, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">And anon, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be with you again,</div>
                     <div class="line">In a trice,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like to the old Vice,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your need to sustain;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, with dagger of lath,</div>
                     <div class="line">In his rage and his wrath,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cries, ah, ha! to the devil:</div>
                     <div class="line">Like a mad lad,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pare thy nails, dad;</div>
                     <div class="line">Adieu, good man devil.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  OLIVIA's garden.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SEBASTIAN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the air; that is the glorious sun;</div>
                     <div class="line">This pearl she gave me, I do feel't and see't;</div>
                     <div class="line">And though 'tis wonder that enwraps me thus,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet 'tis not madness. Where's Antonio, then?</div>
                     <div class="line">I could not find him at the Elephant:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet there he was; and there I found this credit,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he did range the town to seek me out.</div>
                     <div class="line">His counsel now might do me golden service;</div>
                     <div class="line">For though my soul disputes well with my sense,</div>
                     <div class="line">That this may be some error, but no madness,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet doth this accident and flood of fortune</div>
                     <div class="line">So far exceed all instance, all discourse,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I am ready to distrust mine eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">And wrangle with my reason that persuades me</div>
                     <div class="line">To any other trust but that I am mad</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else the lady's mad; yet, if 'twere so,</div>
                     <div class="line">She could not sway her house, command her followers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Take and give back affairs and their dispatch</div>
                     <div class="line">With such a smooth, discreet and stable bearing</div>
                     <div class="line">As I perceive she does: there's something in't</div>
                     <div class="line">That is deceiveable. But here the lady comes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter OLIVIA and Priest</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Blame not this haste of mine. If you mean well,</div>
                     <div class="line">Now go with me and with this holy man</div>
                     <div class="line">Into the chantry by: there, before him,</div>
                     <div class="line">And underneath that consecrated roof,</div>
                     <div class="line">Plight me the full assurance of your faith;</div>
                     <div class="line">That my most jealous and too doubtful soul</div>
                     <div class="line">May live at peace. He shall conceal it</div>
                     <div class="line">Whiles you are willing it shall come to note,</div>
                     <div class="line">What time we will our celebration keep</div>
                     <div class="line">According to my birth. What do you say?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll follow this good man, and go with you;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, having sworn truth, ever will be true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Then lead the way, good father; and heavens so shine,</div>
                     <div class="line">That they may fairly note this act of mine!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Before OLIVIA's house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Before OLIVIA's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Clown and FABIAN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, as thou lovest me, let me see his letter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Master Fabian, grant me another request.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Any thing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not desire to see this letter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">This is, to give a dog, and in recompense desire my</div>
                     <div class="line">dog again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DUKE ORSINO, VIOLA, CURIO, and Lords</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Belong you to the Lady Olivia, friends?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir; we are some of her trappings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">I know thee well; how dost thou, my good fellow?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Truly, sir, the better for my foes and the worse</div>
                     <div class="line">for my friends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Just the contrary; the better for thy friends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">No, sir, the worse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">How can that be?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, sir, they praise me and make an ass of me;</div>
                     <div class="line">now my foes tell me plainly I am an ass: so that by</div>
                     <div class="line">my foes, sir I profit in the knowledge of myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">and by my friends, I am abused: so that,</div>
                     <div class="line">conclusions to be as kisses, if your four negatives</div>
                     <div class="line">make your two affirmatives why then, the worse for</div>
                     <div class="line">my friends and the better for my foes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, this is excellent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, sir, no; though it please you to be</div>
                     <div class="line">one of my friends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt not be the worse for me: there's gold.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">But that it would be double-dealing, sir, I would</div>
                     <div class="line">you could make it another.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, you give me ill counsel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Put your grace in your pocket, sir, for this once,</div>
                     <div class="line">and let your flesh and blood obey it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I will be so much a sinner, to be a</div>
                     <div class="line">double-dealer: there's another.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Primo, secundo, tertio, is a good play; and the old</div>
                     <div class="line">saying is, the third pays for all: the triplex,</div>
                     <div class="line">sir, is a good tripping measure; or the bells of</div>
                     <div class="line">Saint Bennet, sir, may put you in mind; one, two, three.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">You can fool no more money out of me at this throw:</div>
                     <div class="line">if you will let your lady know I am here to speak</div>
                     <div class="line">with her, and bring her along with you, it may awake</div>
                     <div class="line">my bounty further.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, sir, lullaby to your bounty till I come</div>
                     <div class="line">again. I go, sir; but I would not have you to think</div>
                     <div class="line">that my desire of having is the sin of covetousness:</div>
                     <div class="line">but, as you say, sir, let your bounty take a nap, I</div>
                     <div class="line">will awake it anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes the man, sir, that did rescue me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ANTONIO and Officers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">That face of his I do remember well;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet, when I saw it last, it was besmear'd</div>
                     <div class="line">As black as Vulcan in the smoke of war:</div>
                     <div class="line">A bawbling vessel was he captain of,</div>
                     <div class="line">For shallow draught and bulk unprizable;</div>
                     <div class="line">With which such scathful grapple did he make</div>
                     <div class="line">With the most noble bottom of our fleet,</div>
                     <div class="line">That very envy and the tongue of loss</div>
                     <div class="line">Cried fame and honour on him. What's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Officer</div>
                     <div class="line">Orsino, this is that Antonio</div>
                     <div class="line">That took the Phoenix and her fraught from Candy;</div>
                     <div class="line">And this is he that did the Tiger board,</div>
                     <div class="line">When your young nephew Titus lost his leg:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here in the streets, desperate of shame and state,</div>
                     <div class="line">In private brabble did we apprehend him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">He did me kindness, sir, drew on my side;</div>
                     <div class="line">But in conclusion put strange speech upon me:</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not what 'twas but distraction.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Notable pirate! thou salt-water thief!</div>
                     <div class="line">What foolish boldness brought thee to their mercies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom thou, in terms so bloody and so dear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast made thine enemies?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Orsino, noble sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be pleased that I shake off these names you give me:</div>
                     <div class="line">Antonio never yet was thief or pirate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though I confess, on base and ground enough,</div>
                     <div class="line">Orsino's enemy. A witchcraft drew me hither:</div>
                     <div class="line">That most ingrateful boy there by your side,</div>
                     <div class="line">From the rude sea's enraged and foamy mouth</div>
                     <div class="line">Did I redeem; a wreck past hope he was:</div>
                     <div class="line">His life I gave him and did thereto add</div>
                     <div class="line">My love, without retention or restraint,</div>
                     <div class="line">All his in dedication; for his sake</div>
                     <div class="line">Did I expose myself, pure for his love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Into the danger of this adverse town;</div>
                     <div class="line">Drew to defend him when he was beset:</div>
                     <div class="line">Where being apprehended, his false cunning,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not meaning to partake with me in danger,</div>
                     <div class="line">Taught him to face me out of his acquaintance,</div>
                     <div class="line">And grew a twenty years removed thing</div>
                     <div class="line">While one would wink; denied me mine own purse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I had recommended to his use</div>
                     <div class="line">Not half an hour before.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">How can this be?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">When came he to this town?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">To-day, my lord; and for three months before,</div>
                     <div class="line">No interim, not a minute's vacancy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Both day and night did we keep company.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter OLIVIA and Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes the countess: now heaven walks on earth.</div>
                     <div class="line">But for thee, fellow; fellow, thy words are madness:</div>
                     <div class="line">Three months this youth hath tended upon me;</div>
                     <div class="line">But more of that anon. Take him aside.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What would my lord, but that he may not have,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein Olivia may seem serviceable?</div>
                     <div class="line">Cesario, you do not keep promise with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Gracious Olivia,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What do you say, Cesario? Good my lord,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord would speak; my duty hushes me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">If it be aught to the old tune, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">It is as fat and fulsome to mine ear</div>
                     <div class="line">As howling after music.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Still so cruel?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Still so constant, lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">What, to perverseness? you uncivil lady,</div>
                     <div class="line">To whose ingrate and unauspicious altars</div>
                     <div class="line">My soul the faithfull'st offerings hath breathed out</div>
                     <div class="line">That e'er devotion tender'd! What shall I do?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Even what it please my lord, that shall become him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why should I not, had I the heart to do it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like to the Egyptian thief at point of death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Kill what I love?--a savage jealousy</div>
                     <div class="line">That sometimes savours nobly. But hear me this:</div>
                     <div class="line">Since you to non-regardance cast my faith,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that I partly know the instrument</div>
                     <div class="line">That screws me from my true place in your favour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Live you the marble-breasted tyrant still;</div>
                     <div class="line">But this your minion, whom I know you love,</div>
                     <div class="line">And whom, by heaven I swear, I tender dearly,</div>
                     <div class="line">Him will I tear out of that cruel eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where he sits crowned in his master's spite.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, boy, with me; my thoughts are ripe in mischief:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll sacrifice the lamb that I do love,</div>
                     <div class="line">To spite a raven's heart within a dove.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">And I, most jocund, apt and willingly,</div>
                     <div class="line">To do you rest, a thousand deaths would die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Where goes Cesario?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">After him I love</div>
                     <div class="line">More than I love these eyes, more than my life,</div>
                     <div class="line">More, by all mores, than e'er I shall love wife.</div>
                     <div class="line">If I do feign, you witnesses above</div>
                     <div class="line">Punish my life for tainting of my love!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay me, detested! how am I beguiled!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Who does beguile you? who does do you wrong?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast thou forgot thyself? is it so long?</div>
                     <div class="line">Call forth the holy father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither, my lord? Cesario, husband, stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Husband!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, husband: can he that deny?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Her husband, sirrah!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my lord, not I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, it is the baseness of thy fear</div>
                     <div class="line">That makes thee strangle thy propriety:</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear not, Cesario; take thy fortunes up;</div>
                     <div class="line">Be that thou know'st thou art, and then thou art</div>
                     <div class="line">As great as that thou fear'st.</div>
                     <p>Enter Priest</p>
                     <div class="line">O, welcome, father!</div>
                     <div class="line">Father, I charge thee, by thy reverence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Here to unfold, though lately we intended</div>
                     <div class="line">To keep in darkness what occasion now</div>
                     <div class="line">Reveals before 'tis ripe, what thou dost know</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath newly pass'd between this youth and me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Priest</div>
                     <div class="line">A contract of eternal bond of love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Confirm'd by mutual joinder of your hands,</div>
                     <div class="line">Attested by the holy close of lips,</div>
                     <div class="line">Strengthen'd by interchangement of your rings;</div>
                     <div class="line">And all the ceremony of this compact</div>
                     <div class="line">Seal'd in my function, by my testimony:</div>
                     <div class="line">Since when, my watch hath told me, toward my grave</div>
                     <div class="line">I have travell'd but two hours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">O thou dissembling cub! what wilt thou be</div>
                     <div class="line">When time hath sow'd a grizzle on thy case?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or will not else thy craft so quickly grow,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thine own trip shall be thine overthrow?</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, and take her; but direct thy feet</div>
                     <div class="line">Where thou and I henceforth may never meet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I do protest--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, do not swear!</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold little faith, though thou hast too much fear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SIR ANDREW</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">For the love of God, a surgeon! Send one presently</div>
                     <div class="line">to Sir Toby.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">He has broke my head across and has given Sir Toby</div>
                     <div class="line">a bloody coxcomb too: for the love of God, your</div>
                     <div class="line">help! I had rather than forty pound I were at home.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Who has done this, Sir Andrew?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">The count's gentleman, one Cesario: we took him for</div>
                     <div class="line">a coward, but he's the very devil incardinate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">My gentleman, Cesario?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">'Od's lifelings, here he is! You broke my head for</div>
                     <div class="line">nothing; and that that I did, I was set on to do't</div>
                     <div class="line">by Sir Toby.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why do you speak to me? I never hurt you:</div>
                     <div class="line">You drew your sword upon me without cause;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I bespoke you fair, and hurt you not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">If a bloody coxcomb be a hurt, you have hurt me: I</div>
                     <div class="line">think you set nothing by a bloody coxcomb.</div>
                     <p>Enter SIR TOBY BELCH and Clown</p>
                     <div class="line">Here comes Sir Toby halting; you shall hear more:</div>
                     <div class="line">but if he had not been in drink, he would have</div>
                     <div class="line">tickled you othergates than he did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, gentleman! how is't with you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">That's all one: has hurt me, and there's the end</div>
                     <div class="line">on't. Sot, didst see Dick surgeon, sot?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">O, he's drunk, Sir Toby, an hour agone; his eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">were set at eight i' the morning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Then he's a rogue, and a passy measures panyn: I</div>
                     <div class="line">hate a drunken rogue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Away with him! Who hath made this havoc with them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll help you, Sir Toby, because well be dressed together.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you help? an ass-head and a coxcomb and a</div>
                     <div class="line">knave, a thin-faced knave, a gull!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Get him to bed, and let his hurt be look'd to.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Clown, FABIAN, SIR TOBY BELCH, and SIR ANDREW</p>
               <p>Enter SEBASTIAN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sorry, madam, I have hurt your kinsman:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, had it been the brother of my blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">I must have done no less with wit and safety.</div>
                     <div class="line">You throw a strange regard upon me, and by that</div>
                     <div class="line">I do perceive it hath offended you:</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon me, sweet one, even for the vows</div>
                     <div class="line">We made each other but so late ago.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">One face, one voice, one habit, and two persons,</div>
                     <div class="line">A natural perspective, that is and is not!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Antonio, O my dear Antonio!</div>
                     <div class="line">How have the hours rack'd and tortured me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since I have lost thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sebastian are you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear'st thou that, Antonio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">How have you made division of yourself?</div>
                     <div class="line">An apple, cleft in two, is not more twin</div>
                     <div class="line">Than these two creatures. Which is Sebastian?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Most wonderful!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Do I stand there? I never had a brother;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor can there be that deity in my nature,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of here and every where. I had a sister,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom the blind waves and surges have devour'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">Of charity, what kin are you to me?</div>
                     <div class="line">What countryman? what name? what parentage?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Messaline: Sebastian was my father;</div>
                     <div class="line">Such a Sebastian was my brother too,</div>
                     <div class="line">So went he suited to his watery tomb:</div>
                     <div class="line">If spirits can assume both form and suit</div>
                     <div class="line">You come to fright us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">A spirit I am indeed;</div>
                     <div class="line">But am in that dimension grossly clad</div>
                     <div class="line">Which from the womb I did participate.</div>
                     <div class="line">Were you a woman, as the rest goes even,</div>
                     <div class="line">I should my tears let fall upon your cheek,</div>
                     <div class="line">And say 'Thrice-welcome, drowned Viola!'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">My father had a mole upon his brow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">And so had mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">And died that day when Viola from her birth</div>
                     <div class="line">Had number'd thirteen years.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">O, that record is lively in my soul!</div>
                     <div class="line">He finished indeed his mortal act</div>
                     <div class="line">That day that made my sister thirteen years.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">If nothing lets to make us happy both</div>
                     <div class="line">But this my masculine usurp'd attire,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not embrace me till each circumstance</div>
                     <div class="line">Of place, time, fortune, do cohere and jump</div>
                     <div class="line">That I am Viola: which to confirm,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll bring you to a captain in this town,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where lie my maiden weeds; by whose gentle help</div>
                     <div class="line">I was preserved to serve this noble count.</div>
                     <div class="line">All the occurrence of my fortune since</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath been between this lady and this lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To OLIVIA</span>  So comes it, lady, you have been mistook:</div>
                     <div class="line">But nature to her bias drew in that.</div>
                     <div class="line">You would have been contracted to a maid;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor are you therein, by my life, deceived,</div>
                     <div class="line">You are betroth'd both to a maid and man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Be not amazed; right noble is his blood.</div>
                     <div class="line">If this be so, as yet the glass seems true,</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall have share in this most happy wreck.</div>
                     <p>To VIOLA</p>
                     <div class="line">Boy, thou hast said to me a thousand times</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou never shouldst love woman like to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">And all those sayings will I overswear;</div>
                     <div class="line">And those swearings keep as true in soul</div>
                     <div class="line">As doth that orbed continent the fire</div>
                     <div class="line">That severs day from night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me thy hand;</div>
                     <div class="line">And let me see thee in thy woman's weeds.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                     <div class="line">The captain that did bring me first on shore</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath my maid's garments: he upon some action</div>
                     <div class="line">Is now in durance, at Malvolio's suit,</div>
                     <div class="line">A gentleman, and follower of my lady's.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall enlarge him: fetch Malvolio hither:</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet, alas, now I remember me,</div>
                     <div class="line">They say, poor gentleman, he's much distract.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter Clown with a letter, and FABIAN</p>
                     <div class="line">A most extracting frenzy of mine own</div>
                     <div class="line">From my remembrance clearly banish'd his.</div>
                     <div class="line">How does he, sirrah?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Truly, madam, he holds Belzebub at the staves's end as</div>
                     <div class="line">well as a man in his case may do: has here writ a</div>
                     <div class="line">letter to you; I should have given't you to-day</div>
                     <div class="line">morning, but as a madman's epistles are no gospels,</div>
                     <div class="line">so it skills not much when they are delivered.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Open't, and read it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Look then to be well edified when the fool delivers</div>
                     <div class="line">the madman.</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'By the Lord, madam,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">How now! art thou mad?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">No, madam, I do but read madness: an your ladyship</div>
                     <div class="line">will have it as it ought to be, you must allow Vox.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Prithee, read i' thy right wits.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">So I do, madonna; but to read his right wits is to</div>
                     <div class="line">read thus: therefore perpend, my princess, and give ear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Read it you, sirrah.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>To FABIAN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'By the Lord, madam, you wrong me, and the</div>
                     <div class="line">world shall know it: though you have put me into</div>
                     <div class="line">darkness and given your drunken cousin rule over</div>
                     <div class="line">me, yet have I the benefit of my senses as well as</div>
                     <div class="line">your ladyship. I have your own letter that induced</div>
                     <div class="line">me to the semblance I put on; with the which I doubt</div>
                     <div class="line">not but to do myself much right, or you much shame.</div>
                     <div class="line">Think of me as you please. I leave my duty a little</div>
                     <div class="line">unthought of and speak out of my injury.</div>
                     <div class="line">THE MADLY-USED MALVOLIO.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Did he write this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">This savours not much of distraction.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">See him deliver'd, Fabian; bring him hither.</div>
                     <p>Exit FABIAN</p>
                     <div class="line">My lord so please you, these things further</div>
                     <div class="line">thought on,</div>
                     <div class="line">To think me as well a sister as a wife,</div>
                     <div class="line">One day shall crown the alliance on't, so please you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Here at my house and at my proper cost.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I am most apt to embrace your offer.</div>
                     <p>To VIOLA</p>
                     <div class="line">Your master quits you; and for your service done him,</div>
                     <div class="line">So much against the mettle of your sex,</div>
                     <div class="line">So far beneath your soft and tender breeding,</div>
                     <div class="line">And since you call'd me master for so long,</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is my hand: you shall from this time be</div>
                     <div class="line">Your master's mistress.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">A sister! you are she.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter FABIAN, with MALVOLIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this the madman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, my lord, this same.</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, Malvolio!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, you have done me wrong,</div>
                     <div class="line">Notorious wrong.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Have I, Malvolio? no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Lady, you have. Pray you, peruse that letter.</div>
                     <div class="line">You must not now deny it is your hand:</div>
                     <div class="line">Write from it, if you can, in hand or phrase;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or say 'tis not your seal, nor your invention:</div>
                     <div class="line">You can say none of this: well, grant it then</div>
                     <div class="line">And tell me, in the modesty of honour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why you have given me such clear lights of favour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bade me come smiling and cross-garter'd to you,</div>
                     <div class="line">To put on yellow stockings and to frown</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon Sir Toby and the lighter people;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, acting this in an obedient hope,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why have you suffer'd me to be imprison'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Kept in a dark house, visited by the priest,</div>
                     <div class="line">And made the most notorious geck and gull</div>
                     <div class="line">That e'er invention play'd on? tell me why.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, Malvolio, this is not my writing,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though, I confess, much like the character</div>
                     <div class="line">But out of question 'tis Maria's hand.</div>
                     <div class="line">And now I do bethink me, it was she</div>
                     <div class="line">First told me thou wast mad; then camest in smiling,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in such forms which here were presupposed</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon thee in the letter. Prithee, be content:</div>
                     <div class="line">This practise hath most shrewdly pass'd upon thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">But when we know the grounds and authors of it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt be both the plaintiff and the judge</div>
                     <div class="line">Of thine own cause.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Good madam, hear me speak,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let no quarrel nor no brawl to come</div>
                     <div class="line">Taint the condition of this present hour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I have wonder'd at. In hope it shall not,</div>
                     <div class="line">Most freely I confess, myself and Toby</div>
                     <div class="line">Set this device against Malvolio here,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon some stubborn and uncourteous parts</div>
                     <div class="line">We had conceived against him: Maria writ</div>
                     <div class="line">The letter at Sir Toby's great importance;</div>
                     <div class="line">In recompense whereof he hath married her.</div>
                     <div class="line">How with a sportful malice it was follow'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">May rather pluck on laughter than revenge;</div>
                     <div class="line">If that the injuries be justly weigh'd</div>
                     <div class="line">That have on both sides pass'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, poor fool, how have they baffled thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, 'some are born great, some achieve greatness,</div>
                     <div class="line">and some have greatness thrown upon them.' I was</div>
                     <div class="line">one, sir, in this interlude; one Sir Topas, sir; but</div>
                     <div class="line">that's all one. 'By the Lord, fool, I am not mad.'</div>
                     <div class="line">But do you remember? 'Madam, why laugh you at such</div>
                     <div class="line">a barren rascal? an you smile not, he's gagged:'</div>
                     <div class="line">and thus the whirligig of time brings in his revenges.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be revenged on the whole pack of you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath been most notoriously abused.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Pursue him and entreat him to a peace:</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath not told us of the captain yet:</div>
                     <div class="line">When that is known and golden time convents,</div>
                     <div class="line">A solemn combination shall be made</div>
                     <div class="line">Of our dear souls. Meantime, sweet sister,</div>
                     <div class="line">We will not part from hence. Cesario, come;</div>
                     <div class="line">For so you shall be, while you are a man;</div>
                     <div class="line">But when in other habits you are seen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Orsino's mistress and his fancy's queen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all, except Clown</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Sings</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">When that I was and a little tiny boy,</div>
                     <div class="line">With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,</div>
                     <div class="line">A foolish thing was but a toy,</div>
