                              <div class="line">his grounds of faith that all that look on him love</div>
                              <div class="line">him; and on that vice in him will my revenge find</div>
                              <div class="line">notable cause to work.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">What wilt thou do?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I will drop in his way some obscure epistles of</div>
                              <div class="line">love; wherein, by the colour of his beard, the shape</div>
                              <div class="line">of his leg, the manner of his gait, the expressure</div>
                              <div class="line">of his eye, forehead, and complexion, he shall find</div>
                              <div class="line">himself most feelingly personated. I can write very</div>
                              <div class="line">like my lady your niece: on a forgotten matter we</div>
                              <div class="line">can hardly make distinction of our hands.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Excellent! I smell a device.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">I have't in my nose too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">He shall think, by the letters that thou wilt drop,</div>
                              <div class="line">that they come from my niece, and that she's in</div>
                              <div class="line">love with him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                              <div class="line">My purpose is, indeed, a horse of that colour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">And your horse now would make him an ass.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ass, I doubt not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">O, 'twill be admirable!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Sport royal, I warrant you: I know my physic will</div>
                              <div class="line">work with him. I will plant you two, and let the</div>
                              <div class="line">fool make a third, where he shall find the letter:</div>
                              <div class="line">observe his construction of it. For this night, to</div>
                              <div class="line">bed, and dream on the event. Farewell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Good night, Penthesilea.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">Before me, she's a good wench.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">She's a beagle, true-bred, and one that adores me:</div>
                              <div class="line">what o' that?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">I was adored once too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's to bed, knight. Thou hadst need send for</div>
                              <div class="line">more money.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">If I cannot recover your niece, I am a foul way out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Send for money, knight: if thou hast her not i'</div>
                              <div class="line">the end, call me cut.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">If I do not, never trust me, take it how you will.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come, I'll go burn some sack; 'tis too late</div>
                              <div class="line">to go to bed now: come, knight; come, knight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  DUKE ORSINO's palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter DUKE ORSINO, VIOLA, CURIO, and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me some music. Now, good morrow, friends.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, good Cesario, but that piece of song,</div>
                              <div class="line">That old and antique song we heard last night:</div>
                              <div class="line">Methought it did relieve my passion much,</div>
                              <div class="line">More than light airs and recollected terms</div>
                              <div class="line">Of these most brisk and giddy-paced times:</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, but one verse.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">He is not here, so please your lordship that should sing it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">Who was it?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Feste, the jester, my lord; a fool that the lady</div>
                              <div class="line">Olivia's father took much delight in. He is about the house.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">Seek him out, and play the tune the while.</div>
                              <p>Exit CURIO. Music plays</p>
                              <div class="line">Come hither, boy: if ever thou shalt love,</div>
                              <div class="line">In the sweet pangs of it remember me;</div>
                              <div class="line">For such as I am all true lovers are,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unstaid and skittish in all motions else,</div>
                              <div class="line">Save in the constant image of the creature</div>
                              <div class="line">That is beloved. How dost thou like this tune?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">It gives a very echo to the seat</div>
                              <div class="line">Where Love is throned.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou dost speak masterly:</div>
                              <div class="line">My life upon't, young though thou art, thine eye</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath stay'd upon some favour that it loves:</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath it not, boy?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">A little, by your favour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">What kind of woman is't?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">Of your complexion.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">She is not worth thee, then. What years, i' faith?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">About your years, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">Too old by heaven: let still the woman take</div>
                              <div class="line">An elder than herself: so wears she to him,</div>
                              <div class="line">So sways she level in her husband's heart:</div>
                              <div class="line">For, boy, however we do praise ourselves,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our fancies are more giddy and unfirm,</div>
                              <div class="line">More longing, wavering, sooner lost and worn,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than women's are.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">I think it well, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">Then let thy love be younger than thyself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or thy affection cannot hold the bent;</div>
                              <div class="line">For women are as roses, whose fair flower</div>
                              <div class="line">Being once display'd, doth fall that very hour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">And so they are: alas, that they are so;</div>
                              <div class="line">To die, even when they to perfection grow!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter CURIO and Clown</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">O, fellow, come, the song we had last night.</div>
                              <div class="line">Mark it, Cesario, it is old and plain;</div>
                              <div class="line">The spinsters and the knitters in the sun</div>
                              <div class="line">And the free maids that weave their thread with bones</div>
                              <div class="line">Do use to chant it: it is silly sooth,</div>
                              <div class="line">And dallies with the innocence of love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like the old age.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Are you ready, sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay; prithee, sing.</div>
                              <p>Music</p>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <h3 class="bridgehead">SONG.</h3>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Come away, come away, death,</div>
                              <div class="line">And in sad cypress let me be laid;</div>
                              <div class="line">Fly away, fly away breath;</div>
                              <div class="line">I am slain by a fair cruel maid.</div>
                              <div class="line">My shroud of white, stuck all with yew,</div>
                              <div class="line">O, prepare it!</div>
                              <div class="line">My part of death, no one so true</div>
                              <div class="line">Did share it.</div>
                              <div class="line">Not a flower, not a flower sweet</div>
                              <div class="line">On my black coffin let there be strown;</div>
                              <div class="line">Not a friend, not a friend greet</div>
                              <div class="line">My poor corpse, where my bones shall be thrown:</div>
                              <div class="line">A thousand thousand sighs to save,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lay me, O, where</div>
                              <div class="line">Sad true lover never find my grave,</div>
                              <div class="line">To weep there!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">There's for thy pains.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">No pains, sir: I take pleasure in singing, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll pay thy pleasure then.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Truly, sir, and pleasure will be paid, one time or another.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me now leave to leave thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, the melancholy god protect thee; and the</div>
                              <div class="line">tailor make thy doublet of changeable taffeta, for</div>
                              <div class="line">thy mind is a very opal. I would have men of such</div>
                              <div class="line">constancy put to sea, that their business might be</div>
                              <div class="line">every thing and their intent every where; for that's</div>
                              <div class="line">it that always makes a good voyage of nothing. Farewell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">Let all the rest give place.</div>
                              <p>CURIO and Attendants retire</p>
                              <div class="line">Once more, Cesario,</div>
                              <div class="line">Get thee to yond same sovereign cruelty:</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell her, my love, more noble than the world,</div>
                              <div class="line">Prizes not quantity of dirty lands;</div>
                              <div class="line">The parts that fortune hath bestow'd upon her,</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell her, I hold as giddily as fortune;</div>
                              <div class="line">But 'tis that miracle and queen of gems</div>
                              <div class="line">That nature pranks her in attracts my soul.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">But if she cannot love you, sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot be so answer'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">Sooth, but you must.</div>
                              <div class="line">Say that some lady, as perhaps there is,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath for your love a great a pang of heart</div>
                              <div class="line">As you have for Olivia: you cannot love her;</div>
                              <div class="line">You tell her so; must she not then be answer'd?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">There is no woman's sides</div>
                              <div class="line">Can bide the beating of so strong a passion</div>
                              <div class="line">As love doth give my heart; no woman's heart</div>
                              <div class="line">So big, to hold so much; they lack retention</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, their love may be call'd appetite,</div>
                              <div class="line">No motion of the liver, but the palate,</div>
                              <div class="line">That suffer surfeit, cloyment and revolt;</div>
                              <div class="line">But mine is all as hungry as the sea,</div>
                              <div class="line">And can digest as much: make no compare</div>
                              <div class="line">Between that love a woman can bear me</div>
                              <div class="line">And that I owe Olivia.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, but I know--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">What dost thou know?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">Too well what love women to men may owe:</div>
                              <div class="line">In faith, they are as true of heart as we.</div>
                              <div class="line">My father had a daughter loved a man,</div>
                              <div class="line">As it might be, perhaps, were I a woman,</div>
                              <div class="line">I should your lordship.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">And what's her history?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">A blank, my lord. She never told her love,</div>
                              <div class="line">But let concealment, like a worm i' the bud,</div>
                              <div class="line">Feed on her damask cheek: she pined in thought,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with a green and yellow melancholy</div>
                              <div class="line">She sat like patience on a monument,</div>
                              <div class="line">Smiling at grief. Was not this love indeed?</div>
                              <div class="line">We men may say more, swear more: but indeed</div>
                              <div class="line">Our shows are more than will; for still we prove</div>
                              <div class="line">Much in our vows, but little in our love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">But died thy sister of her love, my boy?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">I am all the daughters of my father's house,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all the brothers too: and yet I know not.</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, shall I to this lady?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE ORSINO</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, that's the theme.</div>
                              <div class="line">To her in haste; give her this jewel; say,</div>
                              <div class="line">My love can give no place, bide no denay.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE V.  OLIVIA's garden.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter SIR TOBY BELCH, SIR ANDREW, and FABIAN</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Come thy ways, Signior Fabian.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, I'll come: if I lose a scruple of this sport,</div>
                              <div class="line">let me be boiled to death with melancholy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Wouldst thou not be glad to have the niggardly</div>
                              <div class="line">rascally sheep-biter come by some notable shame?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">I would exult, man: you know, he brought me out o'</div>
                              <div class="line">favour with my lady about a bear-baiting here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">To anger him we'll have the bear again; and we will</div>
                              <div class="line">fool him black and blue: shall we not, Sir Andrew?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">An we do not, it is pity of our lives.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Here comes the little villain.</div>
                              <p>Enter MARIA</p>
                              <div class="line">How now, my metal of India!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Get ye all three into the box-tree: Malvolio's</div>
                              <div class="line">coming down this walk: he has been yonder i' the</div>
                              <div class="line">sun practising behavior to his own shadow this half</div>
                              <div class="line">hour: observe him, for the love of mockery; for I</div>
                              <div class="line">know this letter will make a contemplative idiot of</div>
                              <div class="line">him. Close, in the name of jesting! Lie thou there,</div>
                              <p>Throws down a letter</p>
                              <div class="line">for here comes the trout that must be caught with tickling.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <p>Enter MALVOLIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis but fortune; all is fortune. Maria once told</div>
                              <div class="line">me she did affect me: and I have heard herself come</div>
                              <div class="line">thus near, that, should she fancy, it should be one</div>
                              <div class="line">of my complexion. Besides, she uses me with a more</div>
                              <div class="line">exalted respect than any one else that follows her.</div>
                              <div class="line">What should I think on't?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's an overweening rogue!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">O, peace! Contemplation makes a rare turkey-cock</div>
                              <div class="line">of him: how he jets under his advanced plumes!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">'Slight, I could so beat the rogue!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, I say.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">To be Count Malvolio!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, rogue!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">Pistol him, pistol him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, peace!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">There is example for't; the lady of the Strachy</div>
                              <div class="line">married the yeoman of the wardrobe.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">Fie on him, Jezebel!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">O, peace! now he's deeply in: look how</div>
                              <div class="line">imagination blows him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Having been three months married to her, sitting in</div>
                              <div class="line">my state,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">O, for a stone-bow, to hit him in the eye!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Calling my officers about me, in my branched velvet</div>
                              <div class="line">gown; having come from a day-bed, where I have left</div>
                              <div class="line">Olivia sleeping,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Fire and brimstone!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">O, peace, peace!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">And then to have the humour of state; and after a</div>
                              <div class="line">demure travel of regard, telling them I know my</div>
                              <div class="line">place as I would they should do theirs, to for my</div>
                              <div class="line">kinsman Toby,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Bolts and shackles!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">O peace, peace, peace! now, now.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Seven of my people, with an obedient start, make</div>
                              <div class="line">out for him: I frown the while; and perchance wind</div>
                              <div class="line">up watch, or play with my--some rich jewel. Toby</div>
                              <div class="line">approaches; courtesies there to me,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall this fellow live?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">Though our silence be drawn from us with cars, yet peace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I extend my hand to him thus, quenching my familiar</div>
                              <div class="line">smile with an austere regard of control,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">And does not Toby take you a blow o' the lips then?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Saying, 'Cousin Toby, my fortunes having cast me on</div>
                              <div class="line">your niece give me this prerogative of speech,'--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">What, what?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">'You must amend your drunkenness.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Out, scab!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, patience, or we break the sinews of our plot.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">'Besides, you waste the treasure of your time with</div>
                              <div class="line">a foolish knight,'--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">That's me, I warrant you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">'One Sir Andrew,'--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">I knew 'twas I; for many do call me fool.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">What employment have we here?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Taking up the letter</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">Now is the woodcock near the gin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">O, peace! and the spirit of humour intimate reading</div>
                              <div class="line">aloud to him!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">By my life, this is my lady's hand these be her</div>
                              <div class="line">very C's, her U's and her T's and thus makes she her</div>
                              <div class="line">great P's. It is, in contempt of question, her hand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">Her C's, her U's and her T's: why that?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Reads</span>  'To the unknown beloved, this, and my good</div>
                              <div class="line">wishes:'--her very phrases! By your leave, wax.</div>
                              <div class="line">Soft! and the impressure her Lucrece, with which she</div>
                              <div class="line">uses to seal: 'tis my lady. To whom should this be?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">This wins him, liver and all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Reads</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">Jove knows I love: But who?</div>
                              <div class="line">Lips, do not move;</div>
                              <div class="line">No man must know.</div>
                              <div class="line">'No man must know.' What follows? the numbers</div>
                              <div class="line">altered! 'No man must know:' if this should be</div>
                              <div class="line">thee, Malvolio?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, hang thee, brock!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Reads</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">I may command where I adore;</div>
                              <div class="line">But silence, like a Lucrece knife,</div>
                              <div class="line">With bloodless stroke my heart doth gore:</div>
                              <div class="line">M, O, A, I, doth sway my life.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">A fustian riddle!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Excellent wench, say I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">'M, O, A, I, doth sway my life.' Nay, but first, let</div>
                              <div class="line">me see, let me see, let me see.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">What dish o' poison has she dressed him!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">And with what wing the staniel cheques at it!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">'I may command where I adore.' Why, she may command</div>
                              <div class="line">me: I serve her; she is my lady. Why, this is</div>
                              <div class="line">evident to any formal capacity; there is no</div>
                              <div class="line">obstruction in this: and the end,--what should</div>
                              <div class="line">that alphabetical position portend? If I could make</div>
                              <div class="line">that resemble something in me,--Softly! M, O, A,</div>
                              <div class="line">I,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">O, ay, make up that: he is now at a cold scent.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">Sowter will cry upon't for all this, though it be as</div>
                              <div class="line">rank as a fox.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">M,--Malvolio; M,--why, that begins my name.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">Did not I say he would work it out? the cur is</div>
                              <div class="line">excellent at faults.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">M,--but then there is no consonancy in the sequel;</div>
                              <div class="line">that suffers under probation A should follow but O does.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">And O shall end, I hope.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, or I'll cudgel him, and make him cry O!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">And then I comes behind.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, an you had any eye behind you, you might see</div>
                              <div class="line">more detraction at your heels than fortunes before</div>
                              <div class="line">you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MALVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">M, O, A, I; this simulation is not as the former: and</div>
                              <div class="line">yet, to crush this a little, it would bow to me, for</div>
                              <div class="line">every one of these letters are in my name. Soft!</div>
                              <div class="line">here follows prose.</div>
                              <p>Reads</p>
                              <div class="line">'If this fall into thy hand, revolve. In my stars I</div>
                              <div class="line">am above thee; but be not afraid of greatness: some</div>
                              <div class="line">are born great, some achieve greatness, and some</div>
                              <div class="line">have greatness thrust upon 'em. Thy Fates open</div>
                              <div class="line">their hands; let thy blood and spirit embrace them;</div>
                              <div class="line">and, to inure thyself to what thou art like to be,</div>
                              <div class="line">cast thy humble slough and appear fresh. Be</div>
                              <div class="line">opposite with a kinsman, surly with servants; let</div>
                              <div class="line">thy tongue tang arguments of state; put thyself into</div>
                              <div class="line">the trick of singularity: she thus advises thee</div>
                              <div class="line">that sighs for thee. Remember who commended thy</div>
                              <div class="line">yellow stockings, and wished to see thee ever</div>
                              <div class="line">cross-gartered: I say, remember. Go to, thou art</div>
                              <div class="line">made, if thou desirest to be so; if not, let me see</div>
                              <div class="line">thee a steward still, the fellow of servants, and</div>
                              <div class="line">not worthy to touch Fortune's fingers. Farewell.</div>
                              <div class="line">She that would alter services with thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">THE FORTUNATE-UNHAPPY.'</div>
                              <div class="line">Daylight and champaign discovers not more: this is</div>
                              <div class="line">open. I will be proud, I will read politic authors,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will baffle Sir Toby, I will wash off gross</div>
                              <div class="line">acquaintance, I will be point-devise the very man.</div>
                              <div class="line">I do not now fool myself, to let imagination jade</div>
                              <div class="line">me; for every reason excites to this, that my lady</div>
                              <div class="line">loves me. She did commend my yellow stockings of</div>
                              <div class="line">late, she did praise my leg being cross-gartered;</div>
                              <div class="line">and in this she manifests herself to my love, and</div>
                              <div class="line">with a kind of injunction drives me to these habits</div>
                              <div class="line">of her liking. I thank my stars I am happy. I will</div>
                              <div class="line">be strange, stout, in yellow stockings, and</div>
                              <div class="line">cross-gartered, even with the swiftness of putting</div>
                              <div class="line">on. Jove and my stars be praised! Here is yet a</div>
                              <div class="line">postscript.</div>
                              <p>Reads</p>
                              <div class="line">'Thou canst not choose but know who I am. If thou</div>
                              <div class="line">entertainest my love, let it appear in thy smiling;</div>
                              <div class="line">thy smiles become thee well; therefore in my</div>
                              <div class="line">presence still smile, dear my sweet, I prithee.'</div>
                              <div class="line">Jove, I thank thee: I will smile; I will do</div>
                              <div class="line">everything that thou wilt have me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not give my part of this sport for a pension</div>
                              <div class="line">of thousands to be paid from the Sophy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">I could marry this wench for this device.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">So could I too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">And ask no other dowry with her but such another jest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor I neither.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FABIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">Here comes my noble gull-catcher.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter MARIA</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Wilt thou set thy foot o' my neck?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">Or o' mine either?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall I play my freedom at traytrip, and become thy</div>
                              <div class="line">bond-slave?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">I' faith, or I either?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, thou hast put him in such a dream, that when</div>
                              <div class="line">the image of it leaves him he must run mad.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, but say true; does it work upon him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">Like aqua-vitae with a midwife.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                              <div class="line">If you will then see the fruits of the sport, mark</div>
                              <div class="line">his first approach before my lady: he will come to</div>
                              <div class="line">her in yellow stockings, and 'tis a colour she</div>
                              <div class="line">abhors, and cross-gartered, a fashion she detests;</div>
                              <div class="line">and he will smile upon her, which will now be so</div>
                              <div class="line">unsuitable to her disposition, being addicted to a</div>
                              <div class="line">melancholy as she is, that it cannot but turn him</div>
                              <div class="line">into a notable contempt. If you will see it, follow</div>
                              <div class="line">me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR TOBY BELCH</div>
                              <div class="line">To the gates of Tartar, thou most excellent devil of wit!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR ANDREW</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll make one too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.5">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 3. ACT III</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  OLIVIA's garden.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  OLIVIA's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.4">3. SCENE III.  A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.5">4. SCENE IV.  OLIVIA's garden.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  OLIVIA's garden.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter VIOLA, and Clown with a tabour</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">Save thee, friend, and thy music: dost thou live by</div>
                              <div class="line">thy tabour?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">No, sir, I live by the church.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">Art thou a churchman?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">No such matter, sir: I do live by the church; for</div>
                              <div class="line">I do live at my house, and my house doth stand by</div>
                              <div class="line">the church.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">So thou mayst say, the king lies by a beggar, if a</div>
                              <div class="line">beggar dwell near him; or, the church stands by thy</div>
                              <div class="line">tabour, if thy tabour stand by the church.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">You have said, sir. To see this age! A sentence is</div>
                              <div class="line">but a cheveril glove to a good wit: how quickly the</div>
                              <div class="line">wrong side may be turned outward!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, that's certain; they that dally nicely with</div>
                              <div class="line">words may quickly make them wanton.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">I would, therefore, my sister had had no name, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, man?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, sir, her name's a word; and to dally with that</div>
                              <div class="line">word might make my sister wanton. But indeed words</div>
                              <div class="line">are very rascals since bonds disgraced them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy reason, man?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Troth, sir, I can yield you none without words; and</div>
                              <div class="line">words are grown so false, I am loath to prove</div>
                              <div class="line">reason with them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">I warrant thou art a merry fellow and carest for nothing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Not so, sir, I do care for something; but in my</div>
                              <div class="line">conscience, sir, I do not care for you: if that be</div>
                              <div class="line">to care for nothing, sir, I would it would make you invisible.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">Art not thou the Lady Olivia's fool?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">No, indeed, sir; the Lady Olivia has no folly: she</div>
                              <div class="line">will keep no fool, sir, till she be married; and</div>
                              <div class="line">fools are as like husbands as pilchards are to</div>
                              <div class="line">herrings; the husband's the bigger: I am indeed not</div>
                              <div class="line">her fool, but her corrupter of words.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">I saw thee late at the Count Orsino's.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Foolery, sir, does walk about the orb like the sun,</div>
                              <div class="line">it shines every where. I would be sorry, sir, but</div>
                              <div class="line">the fool should be as oft with your master as with</div>
                              <div class="line">my mistress: I think I saw your wisdom there.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, an thou pass upon me, I'll no more with thee.</div>
                              <div class="line">Hold, there's expenses for thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Now Jove, in his next commodity of hair, send thee a beard!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
                              <div class="line">By my troth, I'll tell thee, I am almost sick for</div>
                              <div class="line">one;</div>
                              <p>Aside</p>
                              <div class="line">though I would not have it grow on my chin. Is thy</div>
                              <div class="line">lady within?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Would not a pair of these have bred, sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIOLA</div>
